37/*
38 * ZFS volume emulation driver.
39 *
40 * Makes a DMU object look like a volume of arbitrary size, up to 2^64 bytes.
41 * Volumes are accessed through the symbolic links named:
42 *
43 * /dev/zvol/dsk/<pool_name>/<dataset_name>
44 * /dev/zvol/rdsk/<pool_name>/<dataset_name>
45 *
46 * These links are created by the /dev filesystem (sdev_zvolops.c).
47 * Volumes are persistent through reboot. No user command needs to be
48 * run before opening and using a device.
49 *
50 * FreeBSD notes.
51 * On FreeBSD ZVOLs are simply GEOM providers like any other storage device
52 * in the system.
53 */
54

125void *zfsdev_state;
126static char *zvol_tag = "zvol_tag";

128#define ZVOL_DUMPSIZE "dumpsize"
129
130#ifdef __FreeBSD__
131/*
132 * In FreeBSD we've replaced the upstream zfsdev_state_lock with the
133 * spa_namespace_lock in the ZVOL code.
134 */
135#define zfsdev_state_lock spa_namespace_lock
136#else
137/*
138 * This lock protects the zfsdev_state structure from being modified
139 * while it's being used, e.g. an open that comes in before a create
140 * finishes. It also protects temporary opens of the dataset so that,
141 * e.g., an open doesn't get a spurious EBUSY.
142 */
143kmutex_t zfsdev_state_lock;
144#endif
145static uint32_t zvol_minors;

147#ifndef illumos
148SYSCTL_DECL(_vfs_zfs);
149SYSCTL_NODE(_vfs_zfs, OID_AUTO, vol, CTLFLAG_RW, 0, "ZFS VOLUME");
150static int volmode = ZFS_VOLMODE_GEOM;
151SYSCTL_INT(_vfs_zfs_vol, OID_AUTO, mode, CTLFLAG_RWTUN, &volmode, 0,
152 "Expose as GEOM providers (1), device files (2) or neither");
153static boolean_t zpool_on_zvol = B_FALSE;
154SYSCTL_INT(_vfs_zfs_vol, OID_AUTO, recursive, CTLFLAG_RWTUN, &zpool_on_zvol, 0,
155 "Allow zpools to use zvols as vdevs (DANGEROUS)");
156
157#endif
158typedef struct zvol_extent {
159 list_node_t ze_node;
160 dva_t ze_dva; /* dva associated with this extent */
161 uint64_t ze_nblks; /* number of blocks in extent */
162} zvol_extent_t;
163
164/*
165 * The in-core state of each volume.
166 */
167typedef struct zvol_state {
168#ifndef illumos
169 LIST_ENTRY(zvol_state) zv_links;
170#endif
171 char zv_name[MAXPATHLEN]; /* pool/dd name */
172 uint64_t zv_volsize; /* amount of space we advertise */
173 uint64_t zv_volblocksize; /* volume block size */
174#ifdef __FreeBSD__
175 struct cdev *zv_dev; /* non-GEOM device */
176 struct g_provider *zv_provider; /* GEOM provider */
177#else
178 minor_t zv_minor; /* minor number */
179#endif
180 uint8_t zv_min_bs; /* minimum addressable block shift */
181 uint8_t zv_flags; /* readonly, dumpified, etc. */
182 objset_t *zv_objset; /* objset handle */
183#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
184 uint32_t zv_open_count[OTYPCNT]; /* open counts */
185#endif
186 uint32_t zv_total_opens; /* total open count */
187 uint32_t zv_sync_cnt; /* synchronous open count */
188 zilog_t *zv_zilog; /* ZIL handle */
189 list_t zv_extents; /* List of extents for dump */
190 znode_t zv_znode; /* for range locking */
191 dmu_buf_t *zv_dbuf; /* bonus handle */
192#ifdef __FreeBSD__
193 int zv_state;
194 int zv_volmode; /* Provide GEOM or cdev */
195 struct bio_queue_head zv_queue;
196 struct mtx zv_queue_mtx; /* zv_queue mutex */
197#endif
198#ifdef __NetBSD__
199 struct disk zv_dk; /* disk statistics */
200 kmutex_t zv_dklock; /* disk statistics */
201#endif
202} zvol_state_t;
203
204#ifndef illumos
205static LIST_HEAD(, zvol_state) all_zvols;
206#endif

208 * zvol specific flags

212#define ZVOL_EXCL 0x4
213#define ZVOL_WCE 0x8

216 * zvol maximum transfer in one DMU tx.

218int zvol_maxphys = DMU_MAX_ACCESS/2;

221 * Toggle unmap functionality.

223boolean_t zvol_unmap_enabled = B_TRUE;

225/*
226 * If true, unmaps requested as synchronous are executed synchronously,
227 * otherwise all unmaps are asynchronous.

229boolean_t zvol_unmap_sync_enabled = B_FALSE;

232SYSCTL_INT(_vfs_zfs_vol, OID_AUTO, unmap_enabled, CTLFLAG_RWTUN,

237 &zvol_unmap_sync_enabled, 0,
238 "UNMAPs requested as sync are executed synchronously");

279static void
280zvol_size_changed(zvol_state_t *zv, uint64_t volsize)
281{
282#ifdef illumos
283 dev_t dev = makedevice(ddi_driver_major(zfs_dip), zv->zv_minor);
284
285 zv->zv_volsize = volsize;
286 VERIFY(ddi_prop_update_int64(dev, zfs_dip,
287 "Size", volsize) == DDI_SUCCESS);
288 VERIFY(ddi_prop_update_int64(dev, zfs_dip,
289 "Nblocks", lbtodb(volsize)) == DDI_SUCCESS);
290
291 /* Notify specfs to invalidate the cached size */
292 spec_size_invalidate(dev, VBLK);
293 spec_size_invalidate(dev, VCHR);
294#endif /* illumos */
295#ifdef __FreeBSD__
296 zv->zv_volsize = volsize;
297 if (zv->zv_volmode == ZFS_VOLMODE_GEOM) {
298 struct g_provider *pp;
299
300 pp = zv->zv_provider;
301 if (pp == NULL)
302 return;
303 g_topology_lock();
304
305 /*
306 * Do not invoke resize event when initial size was zero.
307 * ZVOL initializes the size on first open, this is not
308 * real resizing.
309 */
310 if (pp->mediasize == 0)
311 pp->mediasize = zv->zv_volsize;
312 else
313 g_resize_provider(pp, zv->zv_volsize);
314 g_topology_unlock();
315 }
316#endif /* __FreeBSD__ */
317#ifdef __NetBSD__
318 struct disk_geom *dg = &zv->zv_dk.dk_geom;
319
320 zv->zv_volsize = volsize;
321
322 memset(dg, 0, sizeof(*dg));
323 dg->dg_secsize = DEV_BSIZE; /* XXX 512? */
324 dg->dg_secperunit = zv->zv_volsize / dg->dg_secsize;;
325 disk_set_info(NULL, &zv->zv_dk, "ZVOL");
326#endif
327}
328
329
330int
331zvol_check_volsize(uint64_t volsize, uint64_t blocksize)
332{
333 if (volsize == 0)
334 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
335
336 if (volsize % blocksize != 0)
337 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
338
339#ifdef _ILP32
340 if (volsize - 1 > SPEC_MAXOFFSET_T)
341 return (SET_ERROR(EOVERFLOW));
342#endif
343 return (0);
344}
345
346int
347zvol_check_volblocksize(uint64_t volblocksize)
348{
349 if (volblocksize < SPA_MINBLOCKSIZE ||
350 volblocksize > SPA_OLD_MAXBLOCKSIZE ||
351 !ISP2(volblocksize))
352 return (SET_ERROR(EDOM));
353
354 return (0);
355}
356
357int
358zvol_get_stats(objset_t *os, nvlist_t *nv)
359{
360 int error;
361 dmu_object_info_t doi;
362 uint64_t val;
363
364 error = zap_lookup(os, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ, "size", 8, 1, &val);
365 if (error)
366 return (error);
367
368 dsl_prop_nvlist_add_uint64(nv, ZFS_PROP_VOLSIZE, val);
369
370 error = dmu_object_info(os, ZVOL_OBJ, &doi);
371
372 if (error == 0) {
373 dsl_prop_nvlist_add_uint64(nv, ZFS_PROP_VOLBLOCKSIZE,
374 doi.doi_data_block_size);
375 }
376
377 return (error);
378}
379
380static zvol_state_t *
381zvol_minor_lookup(const char *name)
382{
383#ifdef illumos
384 minor_t minor;
385#endif
386 zvol_state_t *zv;
387
388 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&zfsdev_state_lock));
389
390#ifdef illumos
391 for (minor = 1; minor <= ZFSDEV_MAX_MINOR; minor++)
392#else
393 LIST_FOREACH(zv, &all_zvols, zv_links)
394#endif
395 {
396#ifdef illumos
397 zv = zfsdev_get_soft_state(minor, ZSST_ZVOL);
398 if (zv == NULL)
399 continue;
400#endif
401
402 if (strcmp(zv->zv_name, name) == 0)
403 return (zv);
404 }
405
406 return (NULL);
407}
408
409/* extent mapping arg */
410struct maparg {
411 zvol_state_t *ma_zv;
412 uint64_t ma_blks;
413};
414
415/*ARGSUSED*/
416static int
417zvol_map_block(spa_t *spa, zilog_t *zilog, const blkptr_t *bp,
418 const zbookmark_phys_t *zb, const dnode_phys_t *dnp, void *arg)
419{
420 struct maparg *ma = arg;
421 zvol_extent_t *ze;
422 int bs = ma->ma_zv->zv_volblocksize;
423
424 if (bp == NULL || BP_IS_HOLE(bp) ||
425 zb->zb_object != ZVOL_OBJ || zb->zb_level != 0)
426 return (0);
427
428 VERIFY(!BP_IS_EMBEDDED(bp));
429
430 VERIFY3U(ma->ma_blks, ==, zb->zb_blkid);
431 ma->ma_blks++;
432
433 /* Abort immediately if we have encountered gang blocks */
434 if (BP_IS_GANG(bp))
435 return (SET_ERROR(EFRAGS));
436
437 /*
438 * See if the block is at the end of the previous extent.
439 */
440 ze = list_tail(&ma->ma_zv->zv_extents);
441 if (ze &&
442 DVA_GET_VDEV(BP_IDENTITY(bp)) == DVA_GET_VDEV(&ze->ze_dva) &&
443 DVA_GET_OFFSET(BP_IDENTITY(bp)) ==
444 DVA_GET_OFFSET(&ze->ze_dva) + ze->ze_nblks * bs) {
445 ze->ze_nblks++;
446 return (0);
447 }
448
449 dprintf_bp(bp, "%s", "next blkptr:");
450
451 /* start a new extent */
452 ze = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (zvol_extent_t), KM_SLEEP);
453 ze->ze_dva = bp->blk_dva[0]; /* structure assignment */
454 ze->ze_nblks = 1;
455 list_insert_tail(&ma->ma_zv->zv_extents, ze);
456 return (0);
457}
458
459static void
460zvol_free_extents(zvol_state_t *zv)
461{
462 zvol_extent_t *ze;
463
464 while (ze = list_head(&zv->zv_extents)) {
465 list_remove(&zv->zv_extents, ze);
466 kmem_free(ze, sizeof (zvol_extent_t));
467 }
468}
469
470static int
471zvol_get_lbas(zvol_state_t *zv)
472{
473 objset_t *os = zv->zv_objset;
474 struct maparg ma;
475 int err;
476
477 ma.ma_zv = zv;
478 ma.ma_blks = 0;
479 zvol_free_extents(zv);
480
481 /* commit any in-flight changes before traversing the dataset */
482 txg_wait_synced(dmu_objset_pool(os), 0);
483 err = traverse_dataset(dmu_objset_ds(os), 0,
484 TRAVERSE_PRE | TRAVERSE_PREFETCH_METADATA, zvol_map_block, &ma);
485 if (err || ma.ma_blks != (zv->zv_volsize / zv->zv_volblocksize)) {
486 zvol_free_extents(zv);
487 return (err ? err : EIO);
488 }
489
490 return (0);
491}
492
493/* ARGSUSED */
494void
495zvol_create_cb(objset_t *os, void *arg, cred_t *cr, dmu_tx_t *tx)
496{
497 zfs_creat_t *zct = arg;
498 nvlist_t *nvprops = zct->zct_props;
499 int error;
500 uint64_t volblocksize, volsize;
501
502 VERIFY(nvlist_lookup_uint64(nvprops,
503 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_VOLSIZE), &volsize) == 0);
504 if (nvlist_lookup_uint64(nvprops,
505 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_VOLBLOCKSIZE), &volblocksize) != 0)
506 volblocksize = zfs_prop_default_numeric(ZFS_PROP_VOLBLOCKSIZE);
507
508 /*
509 * These properties must be removed from the list so the generic
510 * property setting step won't apply to them.
511 */
512 VERIFY(nvlist_remove_all(nvprops,
513 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_VOLSIZE)) == 0);
514 (void) nvlist_remove_all(nvprops,
515 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_VOLBLOCKSIZE));
516
517 error = dmu_object_claim(os, ZVOL_OBJ, DMU_OT_ZVOL, volblocksize,
518 DMU_OT_NONE, 0, tx);
519 ASSERT(error == 0);
520
521 error = zap_create_claim(os, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ, DMU_OT_ZVOL_PROP,
522 DMU_OT_NONE, 0, tx);
523 ASSERT(error == 0);
524
525 error = zap_update(os, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ, "size", 8, 1, &volsize, tx);
526 ASSERT(error == 0);
527}
528
529/*
530 * Replay a TX_TRUNCATE ZIL transaction if asked. TX_TRUNCATE is how we
531 * implement DKIOCFREE/free-long-range.
532 */
533static int
534zvol_replay_truncate(zvol_state_t *zv, lr_truncate_t *lr, boolean_t byteswap)
535{
536 uint64_t offset, length;
537
538 if (byteswap)
539 byteswap_uint64_array(lr, sizeof (*lr));
540
541 offset = lr->lr_offset;
542 length = lr->lr_length;
543
544 return (dmu_free_long_range(zv->zv_objset, ZVOL_OBJ, offset, length));
545}
546
547/*
548 * Replay a TX_WRITE ZIL transaction that didn't get committed
549 * after a system failure
550 */
551static int
552zvol_replay_write(zvol_state_t *zv, lr_write_t *lr, boolean_t byteswap)
553{
554 objset_t *os = zv->zv_objset;
555 char *data = (char *)(lr + 1); /* data follows lr_write_t */
556 uint64_t offset, length;
557 dmu_tx_t *tx;
558 int error;
559
560 if (byteswap)
561 byteswap_uint64_array(lr, sizeof (*lr));
562
563 offset = lr->lr_offset;
564 length = lr->lr_length;
565
566 /* If it's a dmu_sync() block, write the whole block */
567 if (lr->lr_common.lrc_reclen == sizeof (lr_write_t)) {
568 uint64_t blocksize = BP_GET_LSIZE(&lr->lr_blkptr);
569 if (length < blocksize) {
570 offset -= offset % blocksize;
571 length = blocksize;
572 }
573 }
574
575 tx = dmu_tx_create(os);
576 dmu_tx_hold_write(tx, ZVOL_OBJ, offset, length);
577 error = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
578 if (error) {
579 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
580 } else {
581 dmu_write(os, ZVOL_OBJ, offset, length, data, tx);
582 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
583 }
584
585 return (error);
586}
587
588/* ARGSUSED */
589static int
590zvol_replay_err(zvol_state_t *zv, lr_t *lr, boolean_t byteswap)
591{
592 return (SET_ERROR(ENOTSUP));
593}
594
595/*
596 * Callback vectors for replaying records.
597 * Only TX_WRITE and TX_TRUNCATE are needed for zvol.
598 */
599zil_replay_func_t *zvol_replay_vector[TX_MAX_TYPE] = {
600 zvol_replay_err, /* 0 no such transaction type */
601 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_CREATE */
602 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_MKDIR */
603 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_MKXATTR */
604 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_SYMLINK */
605 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_REMOVE */
606 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_RMDIR */
607 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_LINK */
608 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_RENAME */
609 zvol_replay_write, /* TX_WRITE */
610 zvol_replay_truncate, /* TX_TRUNCATE */
611 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_SETATTR */
612 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_ACL */
613 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_CREATE_ACL */
614 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_CREATE_ATTR */
615 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_CREATE_ACL_ATTR */
616 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_MKDIR_ACL */
617 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_MKDIR_ATTR */
618 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_MKDIR_ACL_ATTR */
619 zvol_replay_err, /* TX_WRITE2 */
620};
621
622#ifdef illumos
623int
624zvol_name2minor(const char *name, minor_t *minor)
625{
626 zvol_state_t *zv;
627
628 mutex_enter(&zfsdev_state_lock);
629 zv = zvol_minor_lookup(name);
630 if (minor && zv)
631 *minor = zv->zv_minor;
632 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
633 return (zv ? 0 : -1);
634}
635#endif /* illumos */
636
637/*
638 * Create a minor node (plus a whole lot more) for the specified volume.
639 */
640int
641zvol_create_minor(const char *name)
642{
643 zfs_soft_state_t *zs;
644 zvol_state_t *zv;
645 objset_t *os;
646 int error;
647#ifdef illumos
648 dmu_object_info_t doi;
649 minor_t minor = 0;
650 char chrbuf[30], blkbuf[30];
651#endif
652#ifdef __FreeBSD__
653 struct g_provider *pp;
654 struct g_geom *gp;
655 uint64_t mode;
656
657 ZFS_LOG(1, "Creating ZVOL %s...", name);
658#endif
659#ifdef __NetBSD__
660 dmu_object_info_t doi;
661 minor_t minor = 0;
662 vnode_t *vp = NULL;
663 char *devpath;
664 size_t devpathlen = strlen(ZVOL_FULL_DEV_DIR) + strlen(name) + 2;
665#endif
666
667 mutex_enter(&zfsdev_state_lock);
668
669 if (zvol_minor_lookup(name) != NULL) {
670 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
671 return (SET_ERROR(EEXIST));
672 }
673
674 /* lie and say we're read-only */
675 error = dmu_objset_own(name, DMU_OST_ZVOL, B_TRUE, FTAG, &os);
676
677 if (error) {
678 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
679 return (error);
680 }
681
682#ifdef illumos
683 if ((minor = zfsdev_minor_alloc()) == 0) {
684 dmu_objset_disown(os, FTAG);
685 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
686 return (SET_ERROR(ENXIO));
687 }
688
689 if (ddi_soft_state_zalloc(zfsdev_state, minor) != DDI_SUCCESS) {
690 dmu_objset_disown(os, FTAG);
691 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
692 return (SET_ERROR(EAGAIN));
693 }
694 (void) ddi_prop_update_string(minor, zfs_dip, ZVOL_PROP_NAME,
695 (char *)name);
696
697 (void) snprintf(chrbuf, sizeof (chrbuf), "%u,raw", minor);
698
699 if (ddi_create_minor_node(zfs_dip, chrbuf, S_IFCHR,
700 minor, DDI_PSEUDO, 0) == DDI_FAILURE) {
701 ddi_soft_state_free(zfsdev_state, minor);
702 dmu_objset_disown(os, FTAG);
703 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
704 return (SET_ERROR(EAGAIN));
705 }
706
707 (void) snprintf(blkbuf, sizeof (blkbuf), "%u", minor);
708
709 if (ddi_create_minor_node(zfs_dip, blkbuf, S_IFBLK,
710 minor, DDI_PSEUDO, 0) == DDI_FAILURE) {
711 ddi_remove_minor_node(zfs_dip, chrbuf);
712 ddi_soft_state_free(zfsdev_state, minor);
713 dmu_objset_disown(os, FTAG);
714 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
715 return (SET_ERROR(EAGAIN));
716 }
717
718 zs = ddi_get_soft_state(zfsdev_state, minor);
719 zs->zss_type = ZSST_ZVOL;
720 zv = zs->zss_data = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (zvol_state_t), KM_SLEEP);
721#endif /* illumos */
722
723#ifdef __FreeBSD__
724 zv = kmem_zalloc(sizeof(*zv), KM_SLEEP);
725 zv->zv_state = 0;
726 error = dsl_prop_get_integer(name,
727 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_VOLMODE), &mode, NULL);
728 if (error != 0 || mode == ZFS_VOLMODE_DEFAULT)
729 mode = volmode;
730
731 DROP_GIANT();
732 zv->zv_volmode = mode;
733 if (zv->zv_volmode == ZFS_VOLMODE_GEOM) {
734 g_topology_lock();
735 gp = g_new_geomf(&zfs_zvol_class, "zfs::zvol::%s", name);
736 gp->start = zvol_geom_start;
737 gp->access = zvol_geom_access;
738 pp = g_new_providerf(gp, "%s/%s", ZVOL_DRIVER, name);
739 pp->flags |= G_PF_DIRECT_RECEIVE | G_PF_DIRECT_SEND;
740 pp->sectorsize = DEV_BSIZE;
741 pp->mediasize = 0;
742 pp->private = zv;
743
744 zv->zv_provider = pp;
745 bioq_init(&zv->zv_queue);
746 mtx_init(&zv->zv_queue_mtx, "zvol", NULL, MTX_DEF);
747 } else if (zv->zv_volmode == ZFS_VOLMODE_DEV) {
748 struct make_dev_args args;
749
750 make_dev_args_init(&args);
751 args.mda_flags = MAKEDEV_CHECKNAME | MAKEDEV_WAITOK;
752 args.mda_devsw = &zvol_cdevsw;
753 args.mda_cr = NULL;
754 args.mda_uid = UID_ROOT;
755 args.mda_gid = GID_OPERATOR;
756 args.mda_mode = 0640;
757 args.mda_si_drv2 = zv;
758 error = make_dev_s(&args, &zv->zv_dev,
759 "%s/%s", ZVOL_DRIVER, name);
760 if (error != 0) {
761 kmem_free(zv, sizeof(*zv));
762 dmu_objset_disown(os, FTAG);
763 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
764 return (error);
765 }
766 zv->zv_dev->si_iosize_max = MAXPHYS;
767 }
768 LIST_INSERT_HEAD(&all_zvols, zv, zv_links);
769#endif /* __FreeBSD__ */
770
771#ifdef __NetBSD__
772
773 /*
774 * If there's an existing /dev/zvol symlink, try to use the
775 * same minor number we used last time.
776 */
777 devpath = kmem_alloc(devpathlen, KM_SLEEP);
778
779 /* Get full path to ZFS volume disk device */
780 (void) snprintf(devpath, devpathlen, "%s/%s", ZVOL_FULL_DEV_DIR, name);
781
782 error = lookupname(devpath, UIO_SYSSPACE, NO_FOLLOW, NULL, &vp);
783
784 if (error == 0 && vp->v_type != VBLK) {
785 error = EINVAL;
786 }
787
788 if (error == 0) {
789 struct stat sb;
790 vn_lock(vp, LK_EXCLUSIVE | LK_RETRY);
791 error = vn_stat(vp, &sb);
792 VOP_UNLOCK(vp, 0);
793 if (error == 0) {
794 minor = getminor(sb.st_rdev);
795 }
796 }
797
798 if (vp != NULL)
799 VN_RELE(vp);
800
801 /*
802 * If we found a minor but it's already in use, we must pick a new one.
803 */
804
805 if (minor != 0 && zfsdev_get_soft_state(minor, ZSST_ZVOL) != NULL)
806 minor = 0;
807
808 if (minor == 0)
809 minor = zfsdev_minor_alloc();
810
811 if (minor == 0) {
812 dmu_objset_disown(os, zvol_tag);
813 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
814 kmem_free(devpath, devpathlen);
815 return (ENXIO);
816 }
817
818 if (ddi_soft_state_zalloc(zfsdev_state, minor) != DDI_SUCCESS) {
819 dmu_objset_disown(os, zvol_tag);
820 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
821 kmem_free(devpath, devpathlen);
822 return (EAGAIN);
823 }
824 (void) ddi_prop_update_string(minor, zfs_dip, ZVOL_PROP_NAME,
825 (char *)name);
826
827 if (ddi_create_minor_node(zfs_dip, (char *)name, S_IFCHR,
828 minor, DDI_PSEUDO, 0) == DDI_FAILURE) {
829 ddi_soft_state_free(zfsdev_state, minor);
830 dmu_objset_disown(os, zvol_tag);
831 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
832 kmem_free(devpath, devpathlen);
833 return (EAGAIN);
834 }
835
836 if (ddi_create_minor_node(zfs_dip, (char *)name, S_IFBLK,
837 minor, DDI_PSEUDO, 0) == DDI_FAILURE) {
838 ddi_remove_minor_node(zfs_dip, (char *)name);
839 ddi_soft_state_free(zfsdev_state, minor);
840 dmu_objset_disown(os, zvol_tag);
841 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
842 kmem_free(devpath, devpathlen);
843 return (EAGAIN);
844 }
845 zs = ddi_get_soft_state(zfsdev_state, minor);
846 zs->zss_type = ZSST_ZVOL;
847 zv = zs->zss_data = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (zvol_state_t), KM_SLEEP);
848
849 disk_init(&zv->zv_dk, name, &zvol_dkdriver);
850 disk_attach(&zv->zv_dk);
851 mutex_init(&zv->zv_dklock, NULL, MUTEX_DEFAULT, NULL);
852
853 LIST_INSERT_HEAD(&all_zvols, zv, zv_links);
854#endif /* __NetBSD__ */
855
856 (void) strlcpy(zv->zv_name, name, MAXPATHLEN);
857 zv->zv_min_bs = DEV_BSHIFT;
858#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
859 zv->zv_minor = minor;
860#endif
861 zv->zv_objset = os;
862 if (dmu_objset_is_snapshot(os) || !spa_writeable(dmu_objset_spa(os)))
863 zv->zv_flags |= ZVOL_RDONLY;
864 mutex_init(&zv->zv_znode.z_range_lock, NULL, MUTEX_DEFAULT, NULL);
865 avl_create(&zv->zv_znode.z_range_avl, zfs_range_compare,
866 sizeof (rl_t), offsetof(rl_t, r_node));
867 list_create(&zv->zv_extents, sizeof (zvol_extent_t),
868 offsetof(zvol_extent_t, ze_node));
869#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
870 /* get and cache the blocksize */
871 error = dmu_object_info(os, ZVOL_OBJ, &doi);
872 ASSERT(error == 0);
873 zv->zv_volblocksize = doi.doi_data_block_size;
874#endif
875
876 if (spa_writeable(dmu_objset_spa(os))) {
877 if (zil_replay_disable)
878 zil_destroy(dmu_objset_zil(os), B_FALSE);
879 else
880 zil_replay(os, zv, zvol_replay_vector);
881 }
882 dmu_objset_disown(os, FTAG);
883 zv->zv_objset = NULL;
884
885 zvol_minors++;
886
887 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
888#ifdef __FreeBSD__
889 if (zv->zv_volmode == ZFS_VOLMODE_GEOM) {
890 zvol_geom_run(zv);
891 g_topology_unlock();
892 }
893 PICKUP_GIANT();
894
895 ZFS_LOG(1, "ZVOL %s created.", name);
896#endif
897 return (0);
898}
899
900/*
901 * Remove minor node for the specified volume.
902 */
903static int
904zvol_remove_zv(zvol_state_t *zv)
905{
906
907 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&zfsdev_state_lock));
908 if (zv->zv_total_opens != 0)
909 return (SET_ERROR(EBUSY));
910
911#ifdef illumos
912 char nmbuf[20];
913 minor_t minor = zv->zv_minor;
914
915 (void) snprintf(nmbuf, sizeof (nmbuf), "%u,raw", minor);
916 ddi_remove_minor_node(zfs_dip, nmbuf);
917
918 (void) snprintf(nmbuf, sizeof (nmbuf), "%u", minor);
919 ddi_remove_minor_node(zfs_dip, nmbuf);
920#endif
921#ifdef __FreeBSD__
922 ZFS_LOG(1, "ZVOL %s destroyed.", zv->zv_name);
923
924 LIST_REMOVE(zv, zv_links);
925 if (zv->zv_volmode == ZFS_VOLMODE_GEOM) {
926 g_topology_lock();
927 zvol_geom_destroy(zv);
928 g_topology_unlock();
929 } else if (zv->zv_volmode == ZFS_VOLMODE_DEV) {
930 if (zv->zv_dev != NULL)
931 destroy_dev(zv->zv_dev);
932 }
933#endif
934#ifdef __NetBSD__
935 char nmbuf[20];
936 minor_t minor = zv->zv_minor;
937
938 LIST_REMOVE(zv, zv_links);
939
940 (void) snprintf(nmbuf, sizeof (nmbuf), "%s", zv->zv_name);
941 ddi_remove_minor_node(zfs_dip, nmbuf);
942
943 (void) snprintf(nmbuf, sizeof (nmbuf), "%s", zv->zv_name);
944 ddi_remove_minor_node(zfs_dip, nmbuf);
945
946 disk_detach(&zv->zv_dk);
947 disk_destroy(&zv->zv_dk);
948 mutex_destroy(&zv->zv_dklock);
949#endif
950
951 avl_destroy(&zv->zv_znode.z_range_avl);
952 mutex_destroy(&zv->zv_znode.z_range_lock);
953
954 kmem_free(zv, sizeof (zvol_state_t));
955#ifdef illumos
956 ddi_soft_state_free(zfsdev_state, minor);
957#endif
958#ifdef __NetBSD__
959 ddi_soft_state_free(zfsdev_state, minor);
960#endif
961 zvol_minors--;
962 return (0);
963}
964
965int
966zvol_remove_minor(const char *name)
967{
968 zvol_state_t *zv;
969 int rc;
970
971 mutex_enter(&zfsdev_state_lock);
972 if ((zv = zvol_minor_lookup(name)) == NULL) {
973 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
974 return (SET_ERROR(ENXIO));
975 }
976#ifdef __NetBSD__
977 disk_detach(&zv->zv_dk);
978 disk_destroy(&zv->zv_dk);
979 mutex_destroy(&zv->zv_dklock);
980#endif
981 rc = zvol_remove_zv(zv);
982 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
983 return (rc);
984}
985
986int
987zvol_first_open(zvol_state_t *zv)
988{
989 dmu_object_info_t doi;
990 objset_t *os;
991 uint64_t volsize;
992 int error;
993 uint64_t readonly;
994
995 /* lie and say we're read-only */
996 error = dmu_objset_own(zv->zv_name, DMU_OST_ZVOL, B_TRUE,
997 zvol_tag, &os);
998 if (error)
999 return (error);
1000
1001 zv->zv_objset = os;
1002 error = zap_lookup(os, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ, "size", 8, 1, &volsize);
1003 if (error) {
1004 ASSERT(error == 0);
1005 dmu_objset_disown(os, zvol_tag);
1006 return (error);
1007 }
1008
1009 /* get and cache the blocksize */
1010 error = dmu_object_info(os, ZVOL_OBJ, &doi);
1011 if (error) {
1012 ASSERT(error == 0);
1013 dmu_objset_disown(os, zvol_tag);
1014 return (error);
1015 }
1016 zv->zv_volblocksize = doi.doi_data_block_size;
1017
1018 error = dmu_bonus_hold(os, ZVOL_OBJ, zvol_tag, &zv->zv_dbuf);
1019 if (error) {
1020 dmu_objset_disown(os, zvol_tag);
1021 return (error);
1022 }
1023
1024 zvol_size_changed(zv, volsize);
1025 zv->zv_zilog = zil_open(os, zvol_get_data);
1026
1027 VERIFY(dsl_prop_get_integer(zv->zv_name, "readonly", &readonly,
1028 NULL) == 0);
1029 if (readonly || dmu_objset_is_snapshot(os) ||
1030 !spa_writeable(dmu_objset_spa(os)))
1031 zv->zv_flags |= ZVOL_RDONLY;
1032 else
1033 zv->zv_flags &= ~ZVOL_RDONLY;
1034 return (error);
1035}
1036
1037void
1038zvol_last_close(zvol_state_t *zv)
1039{
1040 zil_close(zv->zv_zilog);
1041 zv->zv_zilog = NULL;
1042
1043 dmu_buf_rele(zv->zv_dbuf, zvol_tag);
1044 zv->zv_dbuf = NULL;
1045
1046 /*
1047 * Evict cached data
1048 */
1049 if (dsl_dataset_is_dirty(dmu_objset_ds(zv->zv_objset)) &&
1050 !(zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_RDONLY))
1051 txg_wait_synced(dmu_objset_pool(zv->zv_objset), 0);
1052 dmu_objset_evict_dbufs(zv->zv_objset);
1053
1054 dmu_objset_disown(zv->zv_objset, zvol_tag);
1055 zv->zv_objset = NULL;
1056}
1057
1058#ifdef illumos
1059int
1060zvol_prealloc(zvol_state_t *zv)
1061{
1062 objset_t *os = zv->zv_objset;
1063 dmu_tx_t *tx;
1064 uint64_t refd, avail, usedobjs, availobjs;
1065 uint64_t resid = zv->zv_volsize;
1066 uint64_t off = 0;
1067
1068 /* Check the space usage before attempting to allocate the space */
1069 dmu_objset_space(os, &refd, &avail, &usedobjs, &availobjs);
1070 if (avail < zv->zv_volsize)
1071 return (SET_ERROR(ENOSPC));
1072
1073 /* Free old extents if they exist */
1074 zvol_free_extents(zv);
1075
1076 while (resid != 0) {
1077 int error;
1078 uint64_t bytes = MIN(resid, SPA_OLD_MAXBLOCKSIZE);
1079
1080 tx = dmu_tx_create(os);
1081 dmu_tx_hold_write(tx, ZVOL_OBJ, off, bytes);
1082 error = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
1083 if (error) {
1084 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
1085 (void) dmu_free_long_range(os, ZVOL_OBJ, 0, off);
1086 return (error);
1087 }
1088 dmu_prealloc(os, ZVOL_OBJ, off, bytes, tx);
1089 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
1090 off += bytes;
1091 resid -= bytes;
1092 }
1093 txg_wait_synced(dmu_objset_pool(os), 0);
1094
1095 return (0);
1096}
1097#endif /* illumos */
1098
1099static int
1100zvol_update_volsize(objset_t *os, uint64_t volsize)
1101{
1102 dmu_tx_t *tx;
1103 int error;
1104
1105 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&zfsdev_state_lock));
1106
1107 tx = dmu_tx_create(os);
1108 dmu_tx_hold_zap(tx, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ, TRUE, NULL);
1109 dmu_tx_mark_netfree(tx);
1110 error = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
1111 if (error) {
1112 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
1113 return (error);
1114 }
1115
1116 error = zap_update(os, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ, "size", 8, 1,
1117 &volsize, tx);
1118 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
1119
1120 if (error == 0)
1121 error = dmu_free_long_range(os,
1122 ZVOL_OBJ, volsize, DMU_OBJECT_END);
1123 return (error);
1124}
1125
1126void
1127zvol_remove_minors(const char *name)
1128{
1129#ifdef illumos
1130 zvol_state_t *zv;
1131 char *namebuf;
1132 minor_t minor;
1133
1134 namebuf = kmem_zalloc(strlen(name) + 2, KM_SLEEP);
1135 (void) strncpy(namebuf, name, strlen(name));
1136 (void) strcat(namebuf, "/");
1137 mutex_enter(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1138 for (minor = 1; minor <= ZFSDEV_MAX_MINOR; minor++) {
1139
1140 zv = zfsdev_get_soft_state(minor, ZSST_ZVOL);
1141 if (zv == NULL)
1142 continue;
1143 if (strncmp(namebuf, zv->zv_name, strlen(namebuf)) == 0)
1144 (void) zvol_remove_zv(zv);
1145 }
1146 kmem_free(namebuf, strlen(name) + 2);
1147
1148 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1149#else /* !illumos */
1150 zvol_state_t *zv, *tzv;
1151 size_t namelen;
1152
1153 namelen = strlen(name);
1154
1155 DROP_GIANT();
1156 mutex_enter(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1157
1158 LIST_FOREACH_SAFE(zv, &all_zvols, zv_links, tzv) {
1159 if (strcmp(zv->zv_name, name) == 0 ||
1160 (strncmp(zv->zv_name, name, namelen) == 0 &&
1161 strlen(zv->zv_name) > namelen && (zv->zv_name[namelen] == '/' ||
1162 zv->zv_name[namelen] == '@'))) {
1163 (void) zvol_remove_zv(zv);
1164 }
1165 }
1166
1167 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1168 PICKUP_GIANT();
1169#endif /* illumos */
1170}
1171
1172static int
1173zvol_update_live_volsize(zvol_state_t *zv, uint64_t volsize)
1174{
1175 uint64_t old_volsize = 0ULL;
1176 int error = 0;
1177
1178 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&zfsdev_state_lock));
1179
1180 /*
1181 * Reinitialize the dump area to the new size. If we
1182 * failed to resize the dump area then restore it back to
1183 * its original size. We must set the new volsize prior
1184 * to calling dumpvp_resize() to ensure that the devices'
1185 * size(9P) is not visible by the dump subsystem.
1186 */
1187 old_volsize = zv->zv_volsize;
1188 zvol_size_changed(zv, volsize);
1189
1190#ifdef ZVOL_DUMP
1191 if (zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_DUMPIFIED) {
1192 if ((error = zvol_dumpify(zv)) != 0 ||
1193 (error = dumpvp_resize()) != 0) {
1194 int dumpify_error;
1195
1196 (void) zvol_update_volsize(zv->zv_objset, old_volsize);
1197 zvol_size_changed(zv, old_volsize);
1198 dumpify_error = zvol_dumpify(zv);
1199 error = dumpify_error ? dumpify_error : error;
1200 }
1201 }
1202#endif /* ZVOL_DUMP */
1203
1204#ifdef illumos
1205 /*
1206 * Generate a LUN expansion event.
1207 */
1208 if (error == 0) {
1209 sysevent_id_t eid;
1210 nvlist_t *attr;
1211 char *physpath = kmem_zalloc(MAXPATHLEN, KM_SLEEP);
1212
1213 (void) snprintf(physpath, MAXPATHLEN, "%s%u", ZVOL_PSEUDO_DEV,
1214 zv->zv_minor);
1215
1216 VERIFY(nvlist_alloc(&attr, NV_UNIQUE_NAME, KM_SLEEP) == 0);
1217 VERIFY(nvlist_add_string(attr, DEV_PHYS_PATH, physpath) == 0);
1218
1219 (void) ddi_log_sysevent(zfs_dip, SUNW_VENDOR, EC_DEV_STATUS,
1220 ESC_DEV_DLE, attr, &eid, DDI_SLEEP);
1221
1222 nvlist_free(attr);
1223 kmem_free(physpath, MAXPATHLEN);
1224 }
1225#endif /* illumos */
1226 return (error);
1227}
1228
1229int
1230zvol_set_volsize(const char *name, uint64_t volsize)
1231{
1232 zvol_state_t *zv = NULL;
1233 objset_t *os;
1234 int error;
1235 dmu_object_info_t doi;
1236 uint64_t readonly;
1237 boolean_t owned = B_FALSE;
1238
1239 error = dsl_prop_get_integer(name,
1240 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_READONLY), &readonly, NULL);
1241 if (error != 0)
1242 return (error);
1243 if (readonly)
1244 return (SET_ERROR(EROFS));
1245
1246 mutex_enter(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1247 zv = zvol_minor_lookup(name);
1248
1249 if (zv == NULL || zv->zv_objset == NULL) {
1250 if ((error = dmu_objset_own(name, DMU_OST_ZVOL, B_FALSE,
1251 FTAG, &os)) != 0) {
1252 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1253 return (error);
1254 }
1255 owned = B_TRUE;
1256 if (zv != NULL)
1257 zv->zv_objset = os;
1258 } else {
1259 os = zv->zv_objset;
1260 }
1261
1262 if ((error = dmu_object_info(os, ZVOL_OBJ, &doi)) != 0 ||
1263 (error = zvol_check_volsize(volsize, doi.doi_data_block_size)) != 0)
1264 goto out;
1265
1266 error = zvol_update_volsize(os, volsize);
1267
1268 if (error == 0 && zv != NULL)
1269 error = zvol_update_live_volsize(zv, volsize);
1270out:
1271 if (owned) {
1272 dmu_objset_disown(os, FTAG);
1273 if (zv != NULL)
1274 zv->zv_objset = NULL;
1275 }
1276 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1277 return (error);
1278}
1279
1280/*ARGSUSED*/
1281#ifdef illumos
1282int
1283zvol_open(dev_t *devp, int flag, int otyp, cred_t *cr)
1284#endif
1285#ifdef __FreeBSD__
1286static int
1287zvol_open(struct g_provider *pp, int flag, int count)
1288#endif
1289#ifdef __NetBSD__
1290int
1291zvol_open(dev_t *devp, int flag, int otyp, cred_t *cr)
1292#endif
1293{
1294 zvol_state_t *zv;
1295 int err = 0;
1296
1297#ifdef illumos
1298 mutex_enter(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1299
1300 zv = zfsdev_get_soft_state(getminor(*devp), ZSST_ZVOL);
1301 if (zv == NULL) {
1302 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1303 return (SET_ERROR(ENXIO));
1304 }
1305
1306 if (zv->zv_total_opens == 0)
1307 err = zvol_first_open(zv);
1308 if (err) {
1309 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1310 return (err);
1311 }
1312#endif /* !illumos */
1313#ifdef __FreeBSD__
1314 boolean_t locked = B_FALSE;
1315
1316 if (!zpool_on_zvol && tsd_get(zfs_geom_probe_vdev_key) != NULL) {
1317 /*
1318 * if zfs_geom_probe_vdev_key is set, that means that zfs is
1319 * attempting to probe geom providers while looking for a
1320 * replacement for a missing VDEV. In this case, the
1321 * spa_namespace_lock will not be held, but it is still illegal
1322 * to use a zvol as a vdev. Deadlocks can result if another
1323 * thread has spa_namespace_lock
1324 */
1325 return (EOPNOTSUPP);
1326 }
1327 /*
1328 * Protect against recursively entering spa_namespace_lock
1329 * when spa_open() is used for a pool on a (local) ZVOL(s).
1330 * This is needed since we replaced upstream zfsdev_state_lock
1331 * with spa_namespace_lock in the ZVOL code.
1332 * We are using the same trick as spa_open().
1333 * Note that calls in zvol_first_open which need to resolve
1334 * pool name to a spa object will enter spa_open()
1335 * recursively, but that function already has all the
1336 * necessary protection.
1337 */
1338 if (!MUTEX_HELD(&zfsdev_state_lock)) {
1339 mutex_enter(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1340 locked = B_TRUE;
1341 }
1342
1343 zv = pp->private;
1344 if (zv == NULL) {
1345 if (locked)
1346 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1347 return (SET_ERROR(ENXIO));
1348 }
1349
1350 if (zv->zv_total_opens == 0) {
1351 err = zvol_first_open(zv);
1352 if (err) {
1353 if (locked)
1354 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1355 return (err);
1356 }
1357 pp->mediasize = zv->zv_volsize;
1358 pp->stripeoffset = 0;
1359 pp->stripesize = zv->zv_volblocksize;
1360 }
1361#endif /* __FreeBSD__ */
1362#ifdef __NetBSD__
1363 mutex_enter(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1364
1365 zv = zfsdev_get_soft_state(getminor(*devp), ZSST_ZVOL);
1366 if (zv == NULL) {
1367 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1368 return (SET_ERROR(ENXIO));
1369 }
1370
1371 if (zv->zv_total_opens == 0)
1372 err = zvol_first_open(zv);
1373 if (err) {
1374 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1375 return (err);
1376 }
1377#endif
1378
1379 if ((flag & FWRITE) && (zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_RDONLY)) {
1380 err = SET_ERROR(EROFS);
1381 goto out;
1382 }
1383 if (zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_EXCL) {
1384 err = SET_ERROR(EBUSY);
1385 goto out;
1386 }
1387#ifdef FEXCL
1388 if (flag & FEXCL) {
1389 if (zv->zv_total_opens != 0) {
1390 err = SET_ERROR(EBUSY);
1391 goto out;
1392 }
1393 zv->zv_flags |= ZVOL_EXCL;
1394 }
1395#endif
1396
1397#ifdef illumos
1398 if (zv->zv_open_count[otyp] == 0 || otyp == OTYP_LYR) {
1399 zv->zv_open_count[otyp]++;
1400 zv->zv_total_opens++;
1401 }
1402 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1403#endif
1404#ifdef __FreeBSD__
1405 zv->zv_total_opens += count;
1406 if (locked)
1407 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1408#endif
1409#ifdef __NetBSD__
1410 if (zv->zv_open_count[otyp] == 0 || otyp == OTYP_LYR) {
1411 zv->zv_open_count[otyp]++;
1412 zv->zv_total_opens++;
1413 }
1414 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1415#endif
1416
1417 return (err);
1418out:
1419 if (zv->zv_total_opens == 0)
1420 zvol_last_close(zv);
1421#ifdef __FreeBSD__
1422 if (locked)
1423#endif
1424 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1425
1426 return (err);
1427}
1428
1429/*ARGSUSED*/
1430#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
1431int
1432zvol_close(dev_t dev, int flag, int otyp, cred_t *cr)
1433#endif
1434#ifdef __FreeBSD__
1435static int
1436zvol_close(struct g_provider *pp, int flag, int count)
1437#endif
1438{
1439#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
1440 minor_t minor = getminor(dev);
1441 zvol_state_t *zv;
1442 int error = 0;
1443
1444 mutex_enter(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1445
1446 zv = zfsdev_get_soft_state(minor, ZSST_ZVOL);
1447 if (zv == NULL) {
1448 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1449 return (SET_ERROR(ENXIO));
1450 }
1451#endif /* illumos */
1452#ifdef __FreeBSD__
1453 zvol_state_t *zv;
1454 int error = 0;
1455 boolean_t locked = B_FALSE;
1456
1457 /* See comment in zvol_open(). */
1458 if (!MUTEX_HELD(&zfsdev_state_lock)) {
1459 mutex_enter(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1460 locked = B_TRUE;
1461 }
1462
1463 zv = pp->private;
1464 if (zv == NULL) {
1465 if (locked)
1466 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1467 return (SET_ERROR(ENXIO));
1468 }
1469#endif /* __FreeBSD__ */
1470
1471 if (zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_EXCL) {
1472 ASSERT(zv->zv_total_opens == 1);
1473 zv->zv_flags &= ~ZVOL_EXCL;
1474 }
1475
1476 /*
1477 * If the open count is zero, this is a spurious close.
1478 * That indicates a bug in the kernel / DDI framework.
1479 */
1480#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
1481 ASSERT(zv->zv_open_count[otyp] != 0);
1482#endif
1483 ASSERT(zv->zv_total_opens != 0);
1484
1485 /*
1486 * You may get multiple opens, but only one close.
1487 */
1488#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
1489 zv->zv_open_count[otyp]--;
1490 zv->zv_total_opens--;
1491#else
1492 zv->zv_total_opens -= count;
1493#endif
1494
1495 if (zv->zv_total_opens == 0)
1496 zvol_last_close(zv);
1497
1498#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
1499 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1500#else
1501 if (locked)
1502 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
1503#endif
1504 return (error);
1505}
1506
1507static void
1508zvol_get_done(zgd_t *zgd, int error)
1509{
1510 if (zgd->zgd_db)
1511 dmu_buf_rele(zgd->zgd_db, zgd);
1512
1513 zfs_range_unlock(zgd->zgd_rl);
1514
1515 if (error == 0 && zgd->zgd_bp)
1516 zil_add_block(zgd->zgd_zilog, zgd->zgd_bp);
1517
1518 kmem_free(zgd, sizeof (zgd_t));
1519}
1520
1521/*
1522 * Get data to generate a TX_WRITE intent log record.
1523 */
1524static int
1525zvol_get_data(void *arg, lr_write_t *lr, char *buf, zio_t *zio)
1526{
1527 zvol_state_t *zv = arg;
1528 objset_t *os = zv->zv_objset;
1529 uint64_t object = ZVOL_OBJ;
1530 uint64_t offset = lr->lr_offset;
1531 uint64_t size = lr->lr_length; /* length of user data */
1532 blkptr_t *bp = &lr->lr_blkptr;
1533 dmu_buf_t *db;
1534 zgd_t *zgd;
1535 int error;
1536
1537 ASSERT(zio != NULL);
1538 ASSERT(size != 0);
1539
1540 zgd = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (zgd_t), KM_SLEEP);
1541 zgd->zgd_zilog = zv->zv_zilog;
1542 zgd->zgd_rl = zfs_range_lock(&zv->zv_znode, offset, size, RL_READER);
1543
1544 /*
1545 * Write records come in two flavors: immediate and indirect.
1546 * For small writes it's cheaper to store the data with the
1547 * log record (immediate); for large writes it's cheaper to
1548 * sync the data and get a pointer to it (indirect) so that
1549 * we don't have to write the data twice.
1550 */
1551 if (buf != NULL) { /* immediate write */
1552 error = dmu_read(os, object, offset, size, buf,
1553 DMU_READ_NO_PREFETCH);
1554 } else {
1555 size = zv->zv_volblocksize;
1556 offset = P2ALIGN(offset, size);
1557 error = dmu_buf_hold(os, object, offset, zgd, &db,
1558 DMU_READ_NO_PREFETCH);
1559 if (error == 0) {
1560 blkptr_t *obp = dmu_buf_get_blkptr(db);
1561 if (obp) {
1562 ASSERT(BP_IS_HOLE(bp));
1563 *bp = *obp;
1564 }
1565
1566 zgd->zgd_db = db;
1567 zgd->zgd_bp = bp;
1568
1569 ASSERT(db->db_offset == offset);
1570 ASSERT(db->db_size == size);
1571
1572 error = dmu_sync(zio, lr->lr_common.lrc_txg,
1573 zvol_get_done, zgd);
1574
1575 if (error == 0)
1576 return (0);
1577 }
1578 }
1579
1580 zvol_get_done(zgd, error);
1581
1582 return (error);
1583}
1584
1585/*
1586 * zvol_log_write() handles synchronous writes using TX_WRITE ZIL transactions.
1587 *
1588 * We store data in the log buffers if it's small enough.
1589 * Otherwise we will later flush the data out via dmu_sync().
1590 */
1591ssize_t zvol_immediate_write_sz = 32768;
1592#ifdef _KERNEL
1593SYSCTL_LONG(_vfs_zfs_vol, OID_AUTO, immediate_write_sz, CTLFLAG_RWTUN,
1594 &zvol_immediate_write_sz, 0, "Minimal size for indirect log write");
1595#endif
1596
1597static void
1598zvol_log_write(zvol_state_t *zv, dmu_tx_t *tx, offset_t off, ssize_t resid,
1599 boolean_t sync)
1600{
1601 uint32_t blocksize = zv->zv_volblocksize;
1602 zilog_t *zilog = zv->zv_zilog;
1603 itx_wr_state_t write_state;
1604
1605 if (zil_replaying(zilog, tx))
1606 return;
1607
1608 if (zilog->zl_logbias == ZFS_LOGBIAS_THROUGHPUT)
1609 write_state = WR_INDIRECT;
1610 else if (!spa_has_slogs(zilog->zl_spa) &&
1611 resid >= blocksize && blocksize > zvol_immediate_write_sz)
1612 write_state = WR_INDIRECT;
1613 else if (sync)
1614 write_state = WR_COPIED;
1615 else
1616 write_state = WR_NEED_COPY;
1617
1618 while (resid) {
1619 itx_t *itx;
1620 lr_write_t *lr;
1621 itx_wr_state_t wr_state = write_state;
1622 ssize_t len = resid;
1623
1624 if (wr_state == WR_COPIED && resid > ZIL_MAX_COPIED_DATA)
1625 wr_state = WR_NEED_COPY;
1626 else if (wr_state == WR_INDIRECT)
1627 len = MIN(blocksize - P2PHASE(off, blocksize), resid);
1628
1629 itx = zil_itx_create(TX_WRITE, sizeof (*lr) +
1630 (wr_state == WR_COPIED ? len : 0));
1631 lr = (lr_write_t *)&itx->itx_lr;
1632 if (wr_state == WR_COPIED && dmu_read(zv->zv_objset,
1633 ZVOL_OBJ, off, len, lr + 1, DMU_READ_NO_PREFETCH) != 0) {
1634 zil_itx_destroy(itx);
1635 itx = zil_itx_create(TX_WRITE, sizeof (*lr));
1636 lr = (lr_write_t *)&itx->itx_lr;
1637 wr_state = WR_NEED_COPY;
1638 }
1639
1640 itx->itx_wr_state = wr_state;
1641 lr->lr_foid = ZVOL_OBJ;
1642 lr->lr_offset = off;
1643 lr->lr_length = len;
1644 lr->lr_blkoff = 0;
1645 BP_ZERO(&lr->lr_blkptr);
1646
1647 itx->itx_private = zv;
1648
1649 if (!sync && (zv->zv_sync_cnt == 0))
1650 itx->itx_sync = B_FALSE;
1651
1652 zil_itx_assign(zilog, itx, tx);
1653
1654 off += len;
1655 resid -= len;
1656 }
1657}
1658
1659#ifdef illumos
1660static int
1661zvol_dumpio_vdev(vdev_t *vd, void *addr, uint64_t offset, uint64_t origoffset,
1662 uint64_t size, boolean_t doread, boolean_t isdump)
1663{
1664 vdev_disk_t *dvd;
1665 int c;
1666 int numerrors = 0;
1667
1668 if (vd->vdev_ops == &vdev_mirror_ops ||
1669 vd->vdev_ops == &vdev_replacing_ops ||
1670 vd->vdev_ops == &vdev_spare_ops) {
1671 for (c = 0; c < vd->vdev_children; c++) {
1672 int err = zvol_dumpio_vdev(vd->vdev_child[c],
1673 addr, offset, origoffset, size, doread, isdump);
1674 if (err != 0) {
1675 numerrors++;
1676 } else if (doread) {
1677 break;
1678 }
1679 }
1680 }
1681
1682 if (!vd->vdev_ops->vdev_op_leaf && vd->vdev_ops != &vdev_raidz_ops)
1683 return (numerrors < vd->vdev_children ? 0 : EIO);
1684
1685 if (doread && !vdev_readable(vd))
1686 return (SET_ERROR(EIO));
1687 else if (!doread && !vdev_writeable(vd))
1688 return (SET_ERROR(EIO));
1689
1690 if (vd->vdev_ops == &vdev_raidz_ops) {
1691 return (vdev_raidz_physio(vd,
1692 addr, size, offset, origoffset, doread, isdump));
1693 }
1694
1695 offset += VDEV_LABEL_START_SIZE;
1696
1697 if (ddi_in_panic() || isdump) {
1698 ASSERT(!doread);
1699 if (doread)
1700 return (SET_ERROR(EIO));
1701 dvd = vd->vdev_tsd;
1702 ASSERT3P(dvd, !=, NULL);
1703 return (ldi_dump(dvd->vd_lh, addr, lbtodb(offset),
1704 lbtodb(size)));
1705 } else {
1706 dvd = vd->vdev_tsd;
1707 ASSERT3P(dvd, !=, NULL);
1708 return (vdev_disk_ldi_physio(dvd->vd_lh, addr, size,
1709 offset, doread ? B_READ : B_WRITE));
1710 }
1711}
1712
1713static int
1714zvol_dumpio(zvol_state_t *zv, void *addr, uint64_t offset, uint64_t size,
1715 boolean_t doread, boolean_t isdump)
1716{
1717 vdev_t *vd;
1718 int error;
1719 zvol_extent_t *ze;
1720 spa_t *spa = dmu_objset_spa(zv->zv_objset);
1721
1722 /* Must be sector aligned, and not stradle a block boundary. */
1723 if (P2PHASE(offset, DEV_BSIZE) || P2PHASE(size, DEV_BSIZE) ||
1724 P2BOUNDARY(offset, size, zv->zv_volblocksize)) {
1725 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
1726 }
1727 ASSERT(size <= zv->zv_volblocksize);
1728
1729 /* Locate the extent this belongs to */
1730 ze = list_head(&zv->zv_extents);
1731 while (offset >= ze->ze_nblks * zv->zv_volblocksize) {
1732 offset -= ze->ze_nblks * zv->zv_volblocksize;
1733 ze = list_next(&zv->zv_extents, ze);
1734 }
1735
1736 if (ze == NULL)
1737 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
1738
1739 if (!ddi_in_panic())
1740 spa_config_enter(spa, SCL_STATE, FTAG, RW_READER);
1741
1742 vd = vdev_lookup_top(spa, DVA_GET_VDEV(&ze->ze_dva));
1743 offset += DVA_GET_OFFSET(&ze->ze_dva);
1744 error = zvol_dumpio_vdev(vd, addr, offset, DVA_GET_OFFSET(&ze->ze_dva),
1745 size, doread, isdump);
1746
1747 if (!ddi_in_panic())
1748 spa_config_exit(spa, SCL_STATE, FTAG);
1749
1750 return (error);
1751}
1752#else /* !illumos */
1753static inline int
1754zvol_dumpio(zvol_state_t *zv, void *addr, uint64_t offset, uint64_t size,
1755 boolean_t doread, boolean_t isdump)
1756{
1757 return 0;
1758}
1759#endif /* illumos */
1760
1761#ifdef illumos
1762int
1763zvol_strategy(buf_t *bp)
1764#endif
1765#ifdef __FreeBSD__
1766void
1767zvol_strategy(struct bio *bp)
1768#endif
1769#ifdef __NetBSD__
1770void
1771zvol_strategy(buf_t *bp)
1772#endif
1773{
1774 zvol_state_t *zv;
1775 uint64_t off, volsize;
1776 size_t resid;
1777 char *addr;
1778 objset_t *os;
1779 rl_t *rl;
1780 int error = 0;
1781#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
1782 boolean_t doread = bp->b_flags & B_READ;
1783#else
1784 boolean_t doread = 0;
1785#endif
1786 boolean_t is_dumpified;
1787 boolean_t sync;
1788
1789#ifdef illumos
1790 zfs_soft_state_t *zs = NULL;
1791
1792 if (getminor(bp->b_edev) == 0) {
1793 error = SET_ERROR(EINVAL);
1794 } else {
1795 zs = ddi_get_soft_state(zfsdev_state, getminor(bp->b_edev));
1796 if (zs == NULL)
1797 error = SET_ERROR(ENXIO);
1798 else if (zs->zss_type != ZSST_ZVOL)
1799 error = SET_ERROR(EINVAL);
1800 }
1801
1802 if (error) {
1803 bioerror(bp, error);
1804 biodone(bp);
1805 return (0);
1806 }
1807
1808 zv = zs->zss_data;
1809
1810 if (!(bp->b_flags & B_READ) && (zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_RDONLY)) {
1811 bioerror(bp, EROFS);
1812 biodone(bp);
1813 return (0);
1814 }
1815
1816 off = ldbtob(bp->b_blkno);
1817#endif /* illumos */
1818#ifdef __FreeBSD__
1819 if (bp->bio_to)
1820 zv = bp->bio_to->private;
1821 else
1822 zv = bp->bio_dev->si_drv2;
1823
1824 if (zv == NULL) {
1825 error = SET_ERROR(ENXIO);
1826 goto out;
1827 }
1828
1829 if (bp->bio_cmd != BIO_READ && (zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_RDONLY)) {
1830 error = SET_ERROR(EROFS);
1831 goto out;
1832 }
1833
1834 switch (bp->bio_cmd) {
1835 case BIO_FLUSH:
1836 goto sync;
1837 case BIO_READ:
1838 doread = 1;
1839 case BIO_WRITE:
1840 case BIO_DELETE:
1841 break;
1842 default:
1843 error = EOPNOTSUPP;
1844 goto out;
1845 }
1846
1847 off = bp->bio_offset;
1848#endif /* __FreeBSD__ */
1849#ifdef __NetBSD__
1850 zfs_soft_state_t *zs = NULL;
1851
1852 if (getminor(bp->b_edev) == 0) {
1853 error = SET_ERROR(EINVAL);
1854 } else {
1855 zs = ddi_get_soft_state(zfsdev_state, getminor(bp->b_edev));
1856 if (zs == NULL)
1857 error = SET_ERROR(ENXIO);
1858 else if (zs->zss_type != ZSST_ZVOL)
1859 error = SET_ERROR(EINVAL);
1860 }
1861
1862 if (error) {
1863 bioerror(bp, error);
1864 biodone(bp);
1865 return;
1866 }
1867
1868 zv = zs->zss_data;
1869
1870 if (!(bp->b_flags & B_READ) && (zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_RDONLY)) {
1871 bioerror(bp, EROFS);
1872 biodone(bp);
1873 return;
1874 }
1875 off = (uint64_t)bp->b_blkno * DEV_BSIZE;
1876#endif
1877
1878 volsize = zv->zv_volsize;
1879
1880 os = zv->zv_objset;
1881 ASSERT(os != NULL);
1882
1883#ifdef illumos
1884 bp_mapin(bp);
1885 addr = bp->b_un.b_addr;
1886 resid = bp->b_bcount;
1887
1888 if (resid > 0 && (off < 0 || off >= volsize)) {
1889 bioerror(bp, EIO);
1890 biodone(bp);
1891 return (0);
1892 }
1893
1894 is_dumpified = zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_DUMPIFIED;
1895 sync = ((!(bp->b_flags & B_ASYNC) &&
1896 !(zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_WCE)) ||
1897 (zv->zv_objset->os_sync == ZFS_SYNC_ALWAYS)) &&
1898 !doread && !is_dumpified;
1899#endif /* illumos */
1900#ifdef __FreeBSD__
1901 addr = bp->bio_data;
1902 resid = bp->bio_length;
1903
1904 if (resid > 0 && (off < 0 || off >= volsize)) {
1905 error = SET_ERROR(EIO);
1906 goto out;
1907 }
1908
1909 is_dumpified = B_FALSE;
1910 sync = !doread && !is_dumpified &&
1911 zv->zv_objset->os_sync == ZFS_SYNC_ALWAYS;
1912#endif /* __FreeBSD__ */
1913#ifdef __NetBSD__
1914 addr = bp->b_data;
1915 resid = bp->b_bcount;
1916
1917 if (resid > 0 && off >= volsize) {
1918 bioerror(bp, EIO);
1919 biodone(bp);
1920 return;
1921 }
1922
1923 is_dumpified = B_FALSE;
1924 sync = ((!(bp->b_flags & B_ASYNC) &&
1925 !(zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_WCE)) ||
1926 (zv->zv_objset->os_sync == ZFS_SYNC_ALWAYS)) &&
1927 !doread && !is_dumpified;
1928
1929 mutex_enter(&zv->zv_dklock);
1930 disk_busy(&zv->zv_dk);
1931 mutex_exit(&zv->zv_dklock);
1932#endif
1933
1934 /*
1935 * There must be no buffer changes when doing a dmu_sync() because
1936 * we can't change the data whilst calculating the checksum.
1937 */
1938 rl = zfs_range_lock(&zv->zv_znode, off, resid,
1939 doread ? RL_READER : RL_WRITER);
1940
1941#ifdef __FreeBSD__
1942 if (bp->bio_cmd == BIO_DELETE) {
1943 dmu_tx_t *tx = dmu_tx_create(zv->zv_objset);
1944 error = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
1945 if (error != 0) {
1946 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
1947 } else {
1948 zvol_log_truncate(zv, tx, off, resid, sync);
1949 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
1950 error = dmu_free_long_range(zv->zv_objset, ZVOL_OBJ,
1951 off, resid);
1952 resid = 0;
1953 }
1954 goto unlock;
1955 }
1956#endif
1957 while (resid != 0 && off < volsize) {
1958 size_t size = MIN(resid, zvol_maxphys);
1959 if (is_dumpified) {
1960 size = MIN(size, P2END(off, zv->zv_volblocksize) - off);
1961 error = zvol_dumpio(zv, addr, off, size,
1962 doread, B_FALSE);
1963 } else if (doread) {
1964 error = dmu_read(os, ZVOL_OBJ, off, size, addr,
1965 DMU_READ_PREFETCH);
1966 } else {
1967 dmu_tx_t *tx = dmu_tx_create(os);
1968 dmu_tx_hold_write(tx, ZVOL_OBJ, off, size);
1969 error = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
1970 if (error) {
1971 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
1972 } else {
1973 dmu_write(os, ZVOL_OBJ, off, size, addr, tx);
1974 zvol_log_write(zv, tx, off, size, sync);
1975 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
1976 }
1977 }
1978 if (error) {
1979 /* convert checksum errors into IO errors */
1980 if (error == ECKSUM)
1981 error = SET_ERROR(EIO);
1982 break;
1983 }
1984 off += size;
1985 addr += size;
1986 resid -= size;
1987 }
1988#ifdef __FreeBSD__
1989unlock:
1990#endif
1991 zfs_range_unlock(rl);
1992
1993#ifdef illumos
1994 if ((bp->b_resid = resid) == bp->b_bcount)
1995 bioerror(bp, off > volsize ? EINVAL : error);
1996
1997 if (sync)
1998 zil_commit(zv->zv_zilog, ZVOL_OBJ);
1999 biodone(bp);
2000
2001 return (0);
2002#endif /* illumos */
2003#ifdef __FreeBSD__
2004 bp->bio_completed = bp->bio_length - resid;
2005 if (bp->bio_completed < bp->bio_length && off > volsize)
2006 error = EINVAL;
2007
2008 if (sync) {
2009sync:
2010 zil_commit(zv->zv_zilog, ZVOL_OBJ);
2011 }
2012out:
2013 if (bp->bio_to)
2014 g_io_deliver(bp, error);
2015 else
2016 biofinish(bp, NULL, error);
2017#endif /* __FreeBSD__ */
2018#ifdef __NetBSD__
2019 if ((bp->b_resid = resid) == bp->b_bcount)
2020 bioerror(bp, off > volsize ? EINVAL : error);
2021
2022 if (sync)
2023 zil_commit(zv->zv_zilog, ZVOL_OBJ);
2024 mutex_enter(&zv->zv_dklock);
2025 disk_unbusy(&zv->zv_dk, bp->b_bcount - bp->b_resid, doread);
2026 mutex_exit(&zv->zv_dklock);
2027 biodone(bp);
2028#endif /* __NetBSD__ */
2029}
2030
2031#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
2032/*
2033 * Set the buffer count to the zvol maximum transfer.
2034 * Using our own routine instead of the default minphys()
2035 * means that for larger writes we write bigger buffers on X86
2036 * (128K instead of 56K) and flush the disk write cache less often
2037 * (every zvol_maxphys - currently 1MB) instead of minphys (currently
2038 * 56K on X86 and 128K on sparc).
2039 */
2040void
2041zvol_minphys(struct buf *bp)
2042{
2043 if (bp->b_bcount > zvol_maxphys)
2044 bp->b_bcount = zvol_maxphys;
2045}
2046#endif
2047
2048#ifdef illumos
2049int
2050zvol_dump(dev_t dev, caddr_t addr, daddr_t blkno, int nblocks)
2051{
2052 minor_t minor = getminor(dev);
2053 zvol_state_t *zv;
2054 int error = 0;
2055 uint64_t size;
2056 uint64_t boff;
2057 uint64_t resid;
2058
2059 zv = zfsdev_get_soft_state(minor, ZSST_ZVOL);
2060 if (zv == NULL)
2061 return (SET_ERROR(ENXIO));
2062
2063 if ((zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_DUMPIFIED) == 0)
2064 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
2065
2066 boff = ldbtob(blkno);
2067 resid = ldbtob(nblocks);
2068
2069 VERIFY3U(boff + resid, <=, zv->zv_volsize);
2070
2071 while (resid) {
2072 size = MIN(resid, P2END(boff, zv->zv_volblocksize) - boff);
2073 error = zvol_dumpio(zv, addr, boff, size, B_FALSE, B_TRUE);
2074 if (error)
2075 break;
2076 boff += size;
2077 addr += size;
2078 resid -= size;
2079 }
2080
2081 return (error);
2082}
2083#endif
2084
2085/*ARGSUSED*/
2086#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
2087int
2088zvol_read(dev_t dev, uio_t *uio, cred_t *cr)
2089#endif
2090#ifdef __FreeBSD__
2091int
2092zvol_read(struct cdev *dev, struct uio *uio, int ioflag)
2093#endif
2094{
2095 zvol_state_t *zv;
2096 uint64_t volsize;
2097 rl_t *rl;
2098 int error = 0;
2099
2100#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
2101 minor_t minor = getminor(dev);
2102
2103 zv = zfsdev_get_soft_state(minor, ZSST_ZVOL);
2104 if (zv == NULL)
2105 return (SET_ERROR(ENXIO));
2106#else
2107 zv = dev->si_drv2;
2108#endif
2109
2110 volsize = zv->zv_volsize;
2111 /* uio_loffset == volsize isn't an error as its required for EOF processing. */
2112 if (uio->uio_resid > 0 &&
2113 (uio->uio_loffset < 0 || uio->uio_loffset > volsize))
2114 return (SET_ERROR(EIO));
2115
2116#ifdef illumos
2117 if (zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_DUMPIFIED) {
2118 error = physio(zvol_strategy, NULL, dev, B_READ,
2119 zvol_minphys, uio);
2120 return (error);
2121 }
2122#endif
2123
2124#ifdef __NetBSD__
2125 uint64_t resid = uio->uio_resid;
2126 mutex_enter(&zv->zv_dklock);
2127 disk_busy(&zv->zv_dk);
2128 mutex_exit(&zv->zv_dklock);
2129#endif
2130 rl = zfs_range_lock(&zv->zv_znode, uio->uio_loffset, uio->uio_resid,
2131 RL_READER);
2132 while (uio->uio_resid > 0 && uio->uio_loffset < volsize) {
2133 uint64_t bytes = MIN(uio->uio_resid, DMU_MAX_ACCESS >> 1);
2134
2135 /* don't read past the end */
2136 if (bytes > volsize - uio->uio_loffset)
2137 bytes = volsize - uio->uio_loffset;
2138
2139 error = dmu_read_uio_dbuf(zv->zv_dbuf, uio, bytes);
2140 if (error) {
2141 /* convert checksum errors into IO errors */
2142 if (error == ECKSUM)
2143 error = SET_ERROR(EIO);
2144 break;
2145 }
2146 }
2147 zfs_range_unlock(rl);
2148#ifdef __NetBSD__
2149 mutex_enter(&zv->zv_dklock);
2150 disk_unbusy(&zv->zv_dk, resid - uio->uio_resid, 1);
2151 mutex_exit(&zv->zv_dklock);
2152#endif
2153 return (error);
2154}
2155
2156/*ARGSUSED*/
2157#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
2158int
2159zvol_write(dev_t dev, uio_t *uio, cred_t *cr)
2160#else
2161int
2162zvol_write(struct cdev *dev, struct uio *uio, int ioflag)
2163#endif
2164{
2165 zvol_state_t *zv;
2166 uint64_t volsize;
2167 rl_t *rl;
2168 int error = 0;
2169 boolean_t sync;
2170
2171#if defined(illumos) || defined(__NetBSD__)
2172 minor_t minor = getminor(dev);
2173
2174 zv = zfsdev_get_soft_state(minor, ZSST_ZVOL);
2175 if (zv == NULL)
2176 return (SET_ERROR(ENXIO));
2177#else
2178 zv = dev->si_drv2;
2179#endif
2180
2181 volsize = zv->zv_volsize;
2182 /* uio_loffset == volsize isn't an error as its required for EOF processing. */
2183 if (uio->uio_resid > 0 &&
2184 (uio->uio_loffset < 0 || uio->uio_loffset > volsize))
2185 return (SET_ERROR(EIO));
2186
2187#ifdef illumos
2188 if (zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_DUMPIFIED) {
2189 error = physio(zvol_strategy, NULL, dev, B_WRITE,
2190 zvol_minphys, uio);
2191 return (error);
2192 }
2193
2194 sync = !(zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_WCE) ||
2195#endif
2196#ifdef __FreeBSD__
2197 sync = (ioflag & IO_SYNC) ||
2198#endif
2199#ifdef __NetBSD__
2200 sync = 1 ||
2201#endif
2202 (zv->zv_objset->os_sync == ZFS_SYNC_ALWAYS);
2203
2204#ifdef __NetBSD__
2205 uint64_t resid = uio->uio_resid;
2206 mutex_enter(&zv->zv_dklock);
2207 disk_busy(&zv->zv_dk);
2208 mutex_exit(&zv->zv_dklock);
2209#endif
2210 rl = zfs_range_lock(&zv->zv_znode, uio->uio_loffset, uio->uio_resid,
2211 RL_WRITER);
2212 while (uio->uio_resid > 0 && uio->uio_loffset < volsize) {
2213 uint64_t bytes = MIN(uio->uio_resid, DMU_MAX_ACCESS >> 1);
2214 uint64_t off = uio->uio_loffset;
2215 dmu_tx_t *tx = dmu_tx_create(zv->zv_objset);
2216
2217 if (bytes > volsize - off) /* don't write past the end */
2218 bytes = volsize - off;
2219
2220 dmu_tx_hold_write(tx, ZVOL_OBJ, off, bytes);
2221 error = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
2222 if (error) {
2223 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
2224 break;
2225 }
2226 error = dmu_write_uio_dbuf(zv->zv_dbuf, uio, bytes, tx);
2227 if (error == 0)
2228 zvol_log_write(zv, tx, off, bytes, sync);
2229 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
2230
2231 if (error)
2232 break;
2233 }
2234 zfs_range_unlock(rl);
2235 if (sync)
2236 zil_commit(zv->zv_zilog, ZVOL_OBJ);
2237#ifdef __NetBSD__
2238 mutex_enter(&zv->zv_dklock);
2239 disk_unbusy(&zv->zv_dk, resid - uio->uio_resid, 0);
2240 mutex_exit(&zv->zv_dklock);
2241#endif
2242 return (error);
2243}
2244
2245#ifdef illumos
2246int
2247zvol_getefi(void *arg, int flag, uint64_t vs, uint8_t bs)
2248{
2249 struct uuid uuid = EFI_RESERVED;
2250 efi_gpe_t gpe = { 0 };
2251 uint32_t crc;
2252 dk_efi_t efi;
2253 int length;
2254 char *ptr;
2255
2256 if (ddi_copyin(arg, &efi, sizeof (dk_efi_t), flag))
2257 return (SET_ERROR(EFAULT));
2258 ptr = (char *)(uintptr_t)efi.dki_data_64;
2259 length = efi.dki_length;
2260 /*
2261 * Some clients may attempt to request a PMBR for the
2262 * zvol. Currently this interface will return EINVAL to
2263 * such requests. These requests could be supported by
2264 * adding a check for lba == 0 and consing up an appropriate
2265 * PMBR.
2266 */
2267 if (efi.dki_lba < 1 || efi.dki_lba > 2 || length <= 0)
2268 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
2269
2270 gpe.efi_gpe_StartingLBA = LE_64(34ULL);
2271 gpe.efi_gpe_EndingLBA = LE_64((vs >> bs) - 1);
2272 UUID_LE_CONVERT(gpe.efi_gpe_PartitionTypeGUID, uuid);
2273
2274 if (efi.dki_lba == 1) {
2275 efi_gpt_t gpt = { 0 };
2276
2277 gpt.efi_gpt_Signature = LE_64(EFI_SIGNATURE);
2278 gpt.efi_gpt_Revision = LE_32(EFI_VERSION_CURRENT);
2279 gpt.efi_gpt_HeaderSize = LE_32(sizeof (gpt));
2280 gpt.efi_gpt_MyLBA = LE_64(1ULL);
2281 gpt.efi_gpt_FirstUsableLBA = LE_64(34ULL);
2282 gpt.efi_gpt_LastUsableLBA = LE_64((vs >> bs) - 1);
2283 gpt.efi_gpt_PartitionEntryLBA = LE_64(2ULL);
2284 gpt.efi_gpt_NumberOfPartitionEntries = LE_32(1);
2285 gpt.efi_gpt_SizeOfPartitionEntry =
2286 LE_32(sizeof (efi_gpe_t));
2287 CRC32(crc, &gpe, sizeof (gpe), -1U, crc32_table);
2288 gpt.efi_gpt_PartitionEntryArrayCRC32 = LE_32(~crc);
2289 CRC32(crc, &gpt, sizeof (gpt), -1U, crc32_table);
2290 gpt.efi_gpt_HeaderCRC32 = LE_32(~crc);
2291 if (ddi_copyout(&gpt, ptr, MIN(sizeof (gpt), length),
2292 flag))
2293 return (SET_ERROR(EFAULT));
2294 ptr += sizeof (gpt);
2295 length -= sizeof (gpt);
2296 }
2297 if (length > 0 && ddi_copyout(&gpe, ptr, MIN(sizeof (gpe),
2298 length), flag))
2299 return (SET_ERROR(EFAULT));
2300 return (0);
2301}
2302
2303/*
2304 * BEGIN entry points to allow external callers access to the volume.
2305 */
2306/*
2307 * Return the volume parameters needed for access from an external caller.
2308 * These values are invariant as long as the volume is held open.
2309 */
2310int
2311zvol_get_volume_params(minor_t minor, uint64_t *blksize,
2312 uint64_t *max_xfer_len, void **minor_hdl, void **objset_hdl, void **zil_hdl,
2313 void **rl_hdl, void **bonus_hdl)
2314{
2315 zvol_state_t *zv;
2316
2317 zv = zfsdev_get_soft_state(minor, ZSST_ZVOL);
2318 if (zv == NULL)
2319 return (SET_ERROR(ENXIO));
2320 if (zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_DUMPIFIED)
2321 return (SET_ERROR(ENXIO));
2322
2323 ASSERT(blksize && max_xfer_len && minor_hdl &&
2324 objset_hdl && zil_hdl && rl_hdl && bonus_hdl);
2325
2326 *blksize = zv->zv_volblocksize;
2327 *max_xfer_len = (uint64_t)zvol_maxphys;
2328 *minor_hdl = zv;
2329 *objset_hdl = zv->zv_objset;
2330 *zil_hdl = zv->zv_zilog;
2331 *rl_hdl = &zv->zv_znode;
2332 *bonus_hdl = zv->zv_dbuf;
2333 return (0);
2334}
2335
2336/*
2337 * Return the current volume size to an external caller.
2338 * The size can change while the volume is open.
2339 */
2340uint64_t
2341zvol_get_volume_size(void *minor_hdl)
2342{
2343 zvol_state_t *zv = minor_hdl;
2344
2345 return (zv->zv_volsize);
2346}
2347
2348/*
2349 * Return the current WCE setting to an external caller.
2350 * The WCE setting can change while the volume is open.
2351 */
2352int
2353zvol_get_volume_wce(void *minor_hdl)
2354{
2355 zvol_state_t *zv = minor_hdl;
2356
2357 return ((zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_WCE) ? 1 : 0);
2358}
2359
2360/*
2361 * Entry point for external callers to zvol_log_write
2362 */
2363void
2364zvol_log_write_minor(void *minor_hdl, dmu_tx_t *tx, offset_t off, ssize_t resid,
2365 boolean_t sync)
2366{
2367 zvol_state_t *zv = minor_hdl;
2368
2369 zvol_log_write(zv, tx, off, resid, sync);
2370}
2371/*
2372 * END entry points to allow external callers access to the volume.
2373 */
2374#endif /* illumos */
2375
2376/*
2377 * Log a DKIOCFREE/free-long-range to the ZIL with TX_TRUNCATE.
2378 */
2379static void
2380zvol_log_truncate(zvol_state_t *zv, dmu_tx_t *tx, uint64_t off, uint64_t len,
2381 boolean_t sync)
2382{
2383 itx_t *itx;
2384 lr_truncate_t *lr;
2385 zilog_t *zilog = zv->zv_zilog;
2386
2387 if (zil_replaying(zilog, tx))
2388 return;
2389
2390 itx = zil_itx_create(TX_TRUNCATE, sizeof (*lr));
2391 lr = (lr_truncate_t *)&itx->itx_lr;
2392 lr->lr_foid = ZVOL_OBJ;
2393 lr->lr_offset = off;
2394 lr->lr_length = len;
2395
2396 itx->itx_sync = (sync || zv->zv_sync_cnt != 0);
2397 zil_itx_assign(zilog, itx, tx);
2398}
2399
2400#ifdef illumos
2401/*
2402 * Dirtbag ioctls to support mkfs(1M) for UFS filesystems. See dkio(7I).
2403 * Also a dirtbag dkio ioctl for unmap/free-block functionality.
2404 */
2405/*ARGSUSED*/
2406int
2407zvol_ioctl(dev_t dev, int cmd, intptr_t arg, int flag, cred_t *cr, int *rvalp)
2408{
2409 zvol_state_t *zv;
2410 struct dk_callback *dkc;
2411 int error = 0;
2412 rl_t *rl;
2413
2414 mutex_enter(&zfsdev_state_lock);
2415
2416 zv = zfsdev_get_soft_state(getminor(dev), ZSST_ZVOL);
2417
2418 if (zv == NULL) {
2419 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
2420 return (SET_ERROR(ENXIO));
2421 }
2422 ASSERT(zv->zv_total_opens > 0);
2423
2424 switch (cmd) {
2425
2426 case DKIOCINFO:
2427 {
2428 struct dk_cinfo dki;
2429
2430 bzero(&dki, sizeof (dki));
2431 (void) strcpy(dki.dki_cname, "zvol");
2432 (void) strcpy(dki.dki_dname, "zvol");
2433 dki.dki_ctype = DKC_UNKNOWN;
2434 dki.dki_unit = getminor(dev);
2435 dki.dki_maxtransfer =
2436 1 << (SPA_OLD_MAXBLOCKSHIFT - zv->zv_min_bs);
2437 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
2438 if (ddi_copyout(&dki, (void *)arg, sizeof (dki), flag))
2439 error = SET_ERROR(EFAULT);
2440 return (error);
2441 }
2442
2443 case DKIOCGMEDIAINFO:
2444 {
2445 struct dk_minfo dkm;
2446
2447 bzero(&dkm, sizeof (dkm));
2448 dkm.dki_lbsize = 1U << zv->zv_min_bs;
2449 dkm.dki_capacity = zv->zv_volsize >> zv->zv_min_bs;
2450 dkm.dki_media_type = DK_UNKNOWN;
2451 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
2452 if (ddi_copyout(&dkm, (void *)arg, sizeof (dkm), flag))
2453 error = SET_ERROR(EFAULT);
2454 return (error);
2455 }
2456
2457 case DKIOCGMEDIAINFOEXT:
2458 {
2459 struct dk_minfo_ext dkmext;
2460
2461 bzero(&dkmext, sizeof (dkmext));
2462 dkmext.dki_lbsize = 1U << zv->zv_min_bs;
2463 dkmext.dki_pbsize = zv->zv_volblocksize;
2464 dkmext.dki_capacity = zv->zv_volsize >> zv->zv_min_bs;
2465 dkmext.dki_media_type = DK_UNKNOWN;
2466 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
2467 if (ddi_copyout(&dkmext, (void *)arg, sizeof (dkmext), flag))
2468 error = SET_ERROR(EFAULT);
2469 return (error);
2470 }
2471
2472 case DKIOCGETEFI:
2473 {
2474 uint64_t vs = zv->zv_volsize;
2475 uint8_t bs = zv->zv_min_bs;
2476
2477 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
2478 error = zvol_getefi((void *)arg, flag, vs, bs);
2479 return (error);
2480 }
2481
2482 case DKIOCFLUSHWRITECACHE:
2483 dkc = (struct dk_callback *)arg;
2484 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
2485 zil_commit(zv->zv_zilog, ZVOL_OBJ);
2486 if ((flag & FKIOCTL) && dkc != NULL && dkc->dkc_callback) {
2487 (*dkc->dkc_callback)(dkc->dkc_cookie, error);
2488 error = 0;
2489 }
2490 return (error);
2491
2492 case DKIOCGETWCE:
2493 {
2494 int wce = (zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_WCE) ? 1 : 0;
2495 if (ddi_copyout(&wce, (void *)arg, sizeof (int),
2496 flag))
2497 error = SET_ERROR(EFAULT);
2498 break;
2499 }
2500 case DKIOCSETWCE:
2501 {
2502 int wce;
2503 if (ddi_copyin((void *)arg, &wce, sizeof (int),
2504 flag)) {
2505 error = SET_ERROR(EFAULT);
2506 break;
2507 }
2508 if (wce) {
2509 zv->zv_flags |= ZVOL_WCE;
2510 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
2511 } else {
2512 zv->zv_flags &= ~ZVOL_WCE;
2513 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
2514 zil_commit(zv->zv_zilog, ZVOL_OBJ);
2515 }
2516 return (0);
2517 }
2518
2519 case DKIOCGGEOM:
2520 case DKIOCGVTOC:
2521 /*
2522 * commands using these (like prtvtoc) expect ENOTSUP
2523 * since we're emulating an EFI label
2524 */
2525 error = SET_ERROR(ENOTSUP);
2526 break;
2527
2528 case DKIOCDUMPINIT:
2529 rl = zfs_range_lock(&zv->zv_znode, 0, zv->zv_volsize,
2530 RL_WRITER);
2531 error = zvol_dumpify(zv);
2532 zfs_range_unlock(rl);
2533 break;
2534
2535 case DKIOCDUMPFINI:
2536 if (!(zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_DUMPIFIED))
2537 break;
2538 rl = zfs_range_lock(&zv->zv_znode, 0, zv->zv_volsize,
2539 RL_WRITER);
2540 error = zvol_dump_fini(zv);
2541 zfs_range_unlock(rl);
2542 break;
2543
2544 case DKIOCFREE:
2545 {
2546 dkioc_free_t df;
2547 dmu_tx_t *tx;
2548
2549 if (!zvol_unmap_enabled)
2550 break;
2551
2552 if (ddi_copyin((void *)arg, &df, sizeof (df), flag)) {
2553 error = SET_ERROR(EFAULT);
2554 break;
2555 }
2556
2557 /*
2558 * Apply Postel's Law to length-checking. If they overshoot,
2559 * just blank out until the end, if there's a need to blank
2560 * out anything.
2561 */
2562 if (df.df_start >= zv->zv_volsize)
2563 break; /* No need to do anything... */
2564
2565 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
2566
2567 rl = zfs_range_lock(&zv->zv_znode, df.df_start, df.df_length,
2568 RL_WRITER);
2569 tx = dmu_tx_create(zv->zv_objset);
2570 dmu_tx_mark_netfree(tx);
2571 error = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
2572 if (error != 0) {
2573 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
2574 } else {
2575 zvol_log_truncate(zv, tx, df.df_start,
2576 df.df_length, B_TRUE);
2577 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
2578 error = dmu_free_long_range(zv->zv_objset, ZVOL_OBJ,
2579 df.df_start, df.df_length);
2580 }
2581
2582 zfs_range_unlock(rl);
2583
2584 /*
2585 * If the write-cache is disabled, 'sync' property
2586 * is set to 'always', or if the caller is asking for
2587 * a synchronous free, commit this operation to the zil.
2588 * This will sync any previous uncommitted writes to the
2589 * zvol object.
2590 * Can be overridden by the zvol_unmap_sync_enabled tunable.
2591 */
2592 if ((error == 0) && zvol_unmap_sync_enabled &&
2593 (!(zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_WCE) ||
2594 (zv->zv_objset->os_sync == ZFS_SYNC_ALWAYS) ||
2595 (df.df_flags & DF_WAIT_SYNC))) {
2596 zil_commit(zv->zv_zilog, ZVOL_OBJ);
2597 }
2598
2599 return (error);
2600 }
2601
2602 default:
2603 error = SET_ERROR(ENOTTY);
2604 break;
2605
2606 }
2607 mutex_exit(&zfsdev_state_lock);
2608 return (error);
2609}
2610#endif /* illumos */
2611
2612int
2613zvol_busy(void)
2614{
2615 return (zvol_minors != 0);
2616}
2617
2618void
2619zvol_init(void)
2620{
2621 VERIFY(ddi_soft_state_init(&zfsdev_state, sizeof (zfs_soft_state_t),
2622 1) == 0);
2623#ifndef __FreeBSD__
2624 mutex_init(&zfsdev_state_lock, NULL, MUTEX_DEFAULT, NULL);
2625#endif
2626 ZFS_LOG(1, "ZVOL Initialized.");
2627}
2628
2629void
2630zvol_fini(void)
2631{
2632#ifndef __FreeBSD__
2633 mutex_destroy(&zfsdev_state_lock);
2634#endif
2635 ddi_soft_state_fini(&zfsdev_state);
2636 ZFS_LOG(1, "ZVOL Deinitialized.");
2637}
2638
2639#ifdef illumos
2640/*ARGSUSED*/
2641static int
2642zfs_mvdev_dump_feature_check(void *arg, dmu_tx_t *tx)
2643{
2644 spa_t *spa = dmu_tx_pool(tx)->dp_spa;
2645
2646 if (spa_feature_is_active(spa, SPA_FEATURE_MULTI_VDEV_CRASH_DUMP))
2647 return (1);
2648 return (0);
2649}
2650
2651/*ARGSUSED*/
2652static void
2653zfs_mvdev_dump_activate_feature_sync(void *arg, dmu_tx_t *tx)
2654{
2655 spa_t *spa = dmu_tx_pool(tx)->dp_spa;
2656
2657 spa_feature_incr(spa, SPA_FEATURE_MULTI_VDEV_CRASH_DUMP, tx);
2658}
2659
2660static int
2661zvol_dump_init(zvol_state_t *zv, boolean_t resize)
2662{
2663 dmu_tx_t *tx;
2664 int error;
2665 objset_t *os = zv->zv_objset;
2666 spa_t *spa = dmu_objset_spa(os);
2667 vdev_t *vd = spa->spa_root_vdev;
2668 nvlist_t *nv = NULL;
2669 uint64_t version = spa_version(spa);
2670 uint64_t checksum, compress, refresrv, vbs, dedup;
2671
2672 ASSERT(MUTEX_HELD(&zfsdev_state_lock));
2673 ASSERT(vd->vdev_ops == &vdev_root_ops);
2674
2675 error = dmu_free_long_range(zv->zv_objset, ZVOL_OBJ, 0,
2676 DMU_OBJECT_END);
2677 if (error != 0)
2678 return (error);
2679 /* wait for dmu_free_long_range to actually free the blocks */
2680 txg_wait_synced(dmu_objset_pool(zv->zv_objset), 0);
2681
2682 /*
2683 * If the pool on which the dump device is being initialized has more
2684 * than one child vdev, check that the MULTI_VDEV_CRASH_DUMP feature is
2685 * enabled. If so, bump that feature's counter to indicate that the
2686 * feature is active. We also check the vdev type to handle the
2687 * following case:
2688 * # zpool create test raidz disk1 disk2 disk3
2689 * Now have spa_root_vdev->vdev_children == 1 (the raidz vdev),
2690 * the raidz vdev itself has 3 children.
2691 */
2692 if (vd->vdev_children > 1 || vd->vdev_ops == &vdev_raidz_ops) {
2693 if (!spa_feature_is_enabled(spa,
2694 SPA_FEATURE_MULTI_VDEV_CRASH_DUMP))
2695 return (SET_ERROR(ENOTSUP));
2696 (void) dsl_sync_task(spa_name(spa),
2697 zfs_mvdev_dump_feature_check,
2698 zfs_mvdev_dump_activate_feature_sync, NULL,
2699 2, ZFS_SPACE_CHECK_RESERVED);
2700 }
2701
2702 if (!resize) {
2703 error = dsl_prop_get_integer(zv->zv_name,
2704 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_COMPRESSION), &compress, NULL);
2705 if (error == 0) {
2706 error = dsl_prop_get_integer(zv->zv_name,
2707 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_CHECKSUM), &checksum,
2708 NULL);
2709 }
2710 if (error == 0) {
2711 error = dsl_prop_get_integer(zv->zv_name,
2712 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_REFRESERVATION),
2713 &refresrv, NULL);
2714 }
2715 if (error == 0) {
2716 error = dsl_prop_get_integer(zv->zv_name,
2717 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_VOLBLOCKSIZE), &vbs,
2718 NULL);
2719 }
2720 if (version >= SPA_VERSION_DEDUP && error == 0) {
2721 error = dsl_prop_get_integer(zv->zv_name,
2722 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_DEDUP), &dedup, NULL);
2723 }
2724 }
2725 if (error != 0)
2726 return (error);
2727
2728 tx = dmu_tx_create(os);
2729 dmu_tx_hold_zap(tx, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ, TRUE, NULL);
2730 dmu_tx_hold_bonus(tx, ZVOL_OBJ);
2731 error = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
2732 if (error != 0) {
2733 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
2734 return (error);
2735 }
2736
2737 /*
2738 * If we are resizing the dump device then we only need to
2739 * update the refreservation to match the newly updated
2740 * zvolsize. Otherwise, we save off the original state of the
2741 * zvol so that we can restore them if the zvol is ever undumpified.
2742 */
2743 if (resize) {
2744 error = zap_update(os, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ,
2745 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_REFRESERVATION), 8, 1,
2746 &zv->zv_volsize, tx);
2747 } else {
2748 error = zap_update(os, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ,
2749 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_COMPRESSION), 8, 1,
2750 &compress, tx);
2751 if (error == 0) {
2752 error = zap_update(os, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ,
2753 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_CHECKSUM), 8, 1,
2754 &checksum, tx);
2755 }
2756 if (error == 0) {
2757 error = zap_update(os, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ,
2758 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_REFRESERVATION), 8, 1,
2759 &refresrv, tx);
2760 }
2761 if (error == 0) {
2762 error = zap_update(os, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ,
2763 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_VOLBLOCKSIZE), 8, 1,
2764 &vbs, tx);
2765 }
2766 if (error == 0) {
2767 error = dmu_object_set_blocksize(
2768 os, ZVOL_OBJ, SPA_OLD_MAXBLOCKSIZE, 0, tx);
2769 }
2770 if (version >= SPA_VERSION_DEDUP && error == 0) {
2771 error = zap_update(os, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ,
2772 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_DEDUP), 8, 1,
2773 &dedup, tx);
2774 }
2775 if (error == 0)
2776 zv->zv_volblocksize = SPA_OLD_MAXBLOCKSIZE;
2777 }
2778 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
2779
2780 /*
2781 * We only need update the zvol's property if we are initializing
2782 * the dump area for the first time.
2783 */
2784 if (error == 0 && !resize) {
2785 /*
2786 * If MULTI_VDEV_CRASH_DUMP is active, use the NOPARITY checksum
2787 * function. Otherwise, use the old default -- OFF.
2788 */
2789 checksum = spa_feature_is_active(spa,
2790 SPA_FEATURE_MULTI_VDEV_CRASH_DUMP) ? ZIO_CHECKSUM_NOPARITY :
2791 ZIO_CHECKSUM_OFF;
2792
2793 VERIFY(nvlist_alloc(&nv, NV_UNIQUE_NAME, KM_SLEEP) == 0);
2794 VERIFY(nvlist_add_uint64(nv,
2795 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_REFRESERVATION), 0) == 0);
2796 VERIFY(nvlist_add_uint64(nv,
2797 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_COMPRESSION),
2798 ZIO_COMPRESS_OFF) == 0);
2799 VERIFY(nvlist_add_uint64(nv,
2800 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_CHECKSUM),
2801 checksum) == 0);
2802 if (version >= SPA_VERSION_DEDUP) {
2803 VERIFY(nvlist_add_uint64(nv,
2804 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_DEDUP),
2805 ZIO_CHECKSUM_OFF) == 0);
2806 }
2807
2808 error = zfs_set_prop_nvlist(zv->zv_name, ZPROP_SRC_LOCAL,
2809 nv, NULL);
2810 nvlist_free(nv);
2811 }
2812
2813 /* Allocate the space for the dump */
2814 if (error == 0)
2815 error = zvol_prealloc(zv);
2816 return (error);
2817}
2818
2819static int
2820zvol_dumpify(zvol_state_t *zv)
2821{
2822 int error = 0;
2823 uint64_t dumpsize = 0;
2824 dmu_tx_t *tx;
2825 objset_t *os = zv->zv_objset;
2826
2827 if (zv->zv_flags & ZVOL_RDONLY)
2828 return (SET_ERROR(EROFS));
2829
2830 if (zap_lookup(zv->zv_objset, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ, ZVOL_DUMPSIZE,
2831 8, 1, &dumpsize) != 0 || dumpsize != zv->zv_volsize) {
2832 boolean_t resize = (dumpsize > 0);
2833
2834 if ((error = zvol_dump_init(zv, resize)) != 0) {
2835 (void) zvol_dump_fini(zv);
2836 return (error);
2837 }
2838 }
2839
2840 /*
2841 * Build up our lba mapping.
2842 */
2843 error = zvol_get_lbas(zv);
2844 if (error) {
2845 (void) zvol_dump_fini(zv);
2846 return (error);
2847 }
2848
2849 tx = dmu_tx_create(os);
2850 dmu_tx_hold_zap(tx, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ, TRUE, NULL);
2851 error = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
2852 if (error) {
2853 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
2854 (void) zvol_dump_fini(zv);
2855 return (error);
2856 }
2857
2858 zv->zv_flags |= ZVOL_DUMPIFIED;
2859 error = zap_update(os, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ, ZVOL_DUMPSIZE, 8, 1,
2860 &zv->zv_volsize, tx);
2861 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
2862
2863 if (error) {
2864 (void) zvol_dump_fini(zv);
2865 return (error);
2866 }
2867
2868 txg_wait_synced(dmu_objset_pool(os), 0);
2869 return (0);
2870}
2871
2872static int
2873zvol_dump_fini(zvol_state_t *zv)
2874{
2875 dmu_tx_t *tx;
2876 objset_t *os = zv->zv_objset;
2877 nvlist_t *nv;
2878 int error = 0;
2879 uint64_t checksum, compress, refresrv, vbs, dedup;
2880 uint64_t version = spa_version(dmu_objset_spa(zv->zv_objset));
2881
2882 /*
2883 * Attempt to restore the zvol back to its pre-dumpified state.
2884 * This is a best-effort attempt as it's possible that not all
2885 * of these properties were initialized during the dumpify process
2886 * (i.e. error during zvol_dump_init).
2887 */
2888
2889 tx = dmu_tx_create(os);
2890 dmu_tx_hold_zap(tx, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ, TRUE, NULL);
2891 error = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
2892 if (error) {
2893 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
2894 return (error);
2895 }
2896 (void) zap_remove(os, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ, ZVOL_DUMPSIZE, tx);
2897 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
2898
2899 (void) zap_lookup(zv->zv_objset, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ,
2900 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_CHECKSUM), 8, 1, &checksum);
2901 (void) zap_lookup(zv->zv_objset, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ,
2902 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_COMPRESSION), 8, 1, &compress);
2903 (void) zap_lookup(zv->zv_objset, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ,
2904 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_REFRESERVATION), 8, 1, &refresrv);
2905 (void) zap_lookup(zv->zv_objset, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ,
2906 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_VOLBLOCKSIZE), 8, 1, &vbs);
2907
2908 VERIFY(nvlist_alloc(&nv, NV_UNIQUE_NAME, KM_SLEEP) == 0);
2909 (void) nvlist_add_uint64(nv,
2910 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_CHECKSUM), checksum);
2911 (void) nvlist_add_uint64(nv,
2912 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_COMPRESSION), compress);
2913 (void) nvlist_add_uint64(nv,
2914 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_REFRESERVATION), refresrv);
2915 if (version >= SPA_VERSION_DEDUP &&
2916 zap_lookup(zv->zv_objset, ZVOL_ZAP_OBJ,
2917 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_DEDUP), 8, 1, &dedup) == 0) {
2918 (void) nvlist_add_uint64(nv,
2919 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_DEDUP), dedup);
2920 }
2921 (void) zfs_set_prop_nvlist(zv->zv_name, ZPROP_SRC_LOCAL,
2922 nv, NULL);
2923 nvlist_free(nv);
2924
2925 zvol_free_extents(zv);
2926 zv->zv_flags &= ~ZVOL_DUMPIFIED;
2927 (void) dmu_free_long_range(os, ZVOL_OBJ, 0, DMU_OBJECT_END);
2928 /* wait for dmu_free_long_range to actually free the blocks */
2929 txg_wait_synced(dmu_objset_pool(zv->zv_objset), 0);
2930 tx = dmu_tx_create(os);
2931 dmu_tx_hold_bonus(tx, ZVOL_OBJ);
2932 error = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
2933 if (error) {
2934 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
2935 return (error);
2936 }
2937 if (dmu_object_set_blocksize(os, ZVOL_OBJ, vbs, 0, tx) == 0)
2938 zv->zv_volblocksize = vbs;
2939 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
2940
2941 return (0);
2942}
2943#endif /* illumos */
2944
2945#ifdef __FreeBSD__
2946static void
2947zvol_geom_run(zvol_state_t *zv)
2948{
2949 struct g_provider *pp;
2950
2951 pp = zv->zv_provider;
2952 g_error_provider(pp, 0);
2953
2954 kproc_kthread_add(zvol_geom_worker, zv, &zfsproc, NULL, 0, 0,
2955 "zfskern", "zvol %s", pp->name + sizeof(ZVOL_DRIVER));
2956}
2957
2958static void
2959zvol_geom_destroy(zvol_state_t *zv)
2960{
2961 struct g_provider *pp;
2962
2963 g_topology_assert();
2964
2965 mtx_lock(&zv->zv_queue_mtx);
2966 zv->zv_state = 1;
2967 wakeup_one(&zv->zv_queue);
2968 while (zv->zv_state != 2)
2969 msleep(&zv->zv_state, &zv->zv_queue_mtx, 0, "zvol:w", 0);
2970 mtx_destroy(&zv->zv_queue_mtx);
2971
2972 pp = zv->zv_provider;
2973 zv->zv_provider = NULL;
2974 pp->private = NULL;
2975 g_wither_geom(pp->geom, ENXIO);
2976}
2977
2978static int
2979zvol_geom_access(struct g_provider *pp, int acr, int acw, int ace)
2980{
2981 int count, error, flags;
2982
2983 g_topology_assert();
2984
2985 /*
2986 * To make it easier we expect either open or close, but not both
2987 * at the same time.
2988 */
2989 KASSERT((acr >= 0 && acw >= 0 && ace >= 0) ||
2990 (acr <= 0 && acw <= 0 && ace <= 0),
2991 ("Unsupported access request to %s (acr=%d, acw=%d, ace=%d).",
2992 pp->name, acr, acw, ace));
2993
2994 if (pp->private == NULL) {
2995 if (acr <= 0 && acw <= 0 && ace <= 0)
2996 return (0);
2997 return (pp->error);
2998 }
2999
3000 /*
3001 * We don't pass FEXCL flag to zvol_open()/zvol_close() if ace != 0,
3002 * because GEOM already handles that and handles it a bit differently.
3003 * GEOM allows for multiple read/exclusive consumers and ZFS allows
3004 * only one exclusive consumer, no matter if it is reader or writer.
3005 * I like better the way GEOM works so I'll leave it for GEOM to
3006 * decide what to do.
3007 */
3008
3009 count = acr + acw + ace;
3010 if (count == 0)
3011 return (0);
3012
3013 flags = 0;
3014 if (acr != 0 || ace != 0)
3015 flags |= FREAD;
3016 if (acw != 0)
3017 flags |= FWRITE;
3018
3019 g_topology_unlock();
3020 if (count > 0)
3021 error = zvol_open(pp, flags, count);
3022 else
3023 error = zvol_close(pp, flags, -count);
3024 g_topology_lock();
3025 return (error);
3026}
3027
3028static void
3029zvol_geom_start(struct bio *bp)
3030{
3031 zvol_state_t *zv;
3032 boolean_t first;
3033
3034 zv = bp->bio_to->private;
3035 ASSERT(zv != NULL);
3036 switch (bp->bio_cmd) {
3037 case BIO_FLUSH:
3038 if (!THREAD_CAN_SLEEP())
3039 goto enqueue;
3040 zil_commit(zv->zv_zilog, ZVOL_OBJ);
3041 g_io_deliver(bp, 0);
3042 break;
3043 case BIO_READ:
3044 case BIO_WRITE:
3045 case BIO_DELETE:
3046 if (!THREAD_CAN_SLEEP())
3047 goto enqueue;
3048 zvol_strategy(bp);
3049 break;
3050 case BIO_GETATTR: {
3051 spa_t *spa = dmu_objset_spa(zv->zv_objset);
3052 uint64_t refd, avail, usedobjs, availobjs, val;
3053
3054 if (g_handleattr_int(bp, "GEOM::candelete", 1))
3055 return;
3056 if (strcmp(bp->bio_attribute, "blocksavail") == 0) {
3057 dmu_objset_space(zv->zv_objset, &refd, &avail,
3058 &usedobjs, &availobjs);
3059 if (g_handleattr_off_t(bp, "blocksavail",
3060 avail / DEV_BSIZE))
3061 return;
3062 } else if (strcmp(bp->bio_attribute, "blocksused") == 0) {
3063 dmu_objset_space(zv->zv_objset, &refd, &avail,
3064 &usedobjs, &availobjs);
3065 if (g_handleattr_off_t(bp, "blocksused",
3066 refd / DEV_BSIZE))
3067 return;
3068 } else if (strcmp(bp->bio_attribute, "poolblocksavail") == 0) {
3069 avail = metaslab_class_get_space(spa_normal_class(spa));
3070 avail -= metaslab_class_get_alloc(spa_normal_class(spa));
3071 if (g_handleattr_off_t(bp, "poolblocksavail",
3072 avail / DEV_BSIZE))
3073 return;
3074 } else if (strcmp(bp->bio_attribute, "poolblocksused") == 0) {
3075 refd = metaslab_class_get_alloc(spa_normal_class(spa));
